AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words referring to the physical universe. Some languages may not have a single word for the universe and may have to use a phrase such as 'rain, soil, and things of the sky' or 'sky, land, and water' or a descriptive phrase such as 'everything you can see' or 'everything that exists'.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno ya kawaida yanayotaja au kueleza ulimwengu wa asili tu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to everything we can see?
(1) Maneno gani yanarejea katika kila kitu tunachoweza kukiona?

ExampleWords.AUni: universe, creation, cosmos, heaven and earth, macrocosm, everything that exists
ulimwengu wa asili, ulimwengu unaoonekana, mbingu na nchi, uumbaji wote

AStr.Run: In the beginning God created <the heavens and the earth>.
Mwanzoni Mungu aliumba <mbingu na nchi>.
Use this domain for words related to the sky.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na anga.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to the sky?
(1) Maneno gani yanatumika kutaja anga?
(2) What words refer to the air around the earth?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja hewa inayozunguka dunia?

ExampleWords.AUni: air, atmosphere, airspace, stratosphere, ozone layer

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used to refer to the place or area beyond the sky?
(3) Maneno gani yanatumika kutaja mahali au eneo ng'ambo ya anga?

ExampleWords.AUni: heaven, space, outer space, ether, void, solar system
mbingu, anga za juu, nafasi ya nje

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something in the sky or something that happens in the sky?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea lolote angani au lolote linalotokea angani?
(5) What words describe the appearance of the sky?
(5) Maneno yapi yanaelezea sura ya anga?

ExampleWords.AUni: blue, clear, black (night), cloudy, cloud filled, brilliant, dark, night sky, foreboding, stormy, dark, star studded
buluu, nyeusi (usiku), angavu, hali ya mawingu, hali ya kung'aa, giza, utabiri wa anga, ubashiri wa anga, hali ya dhoruba, kutakapaa kwa nyota, kung'aa kwa nyota

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the edge of the sky where it meets the ground?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja ukingo wa anga, mahali anga linapokutana na ardhi?
(7) What words refer to something in the sky?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja kitu angani?
(8) What words refer to the lights that appear in the northern (or southern) sky?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja ming'ao karibu na ncha ya Kaskazini au ya Kusini?
(9) What words refer to something being in the sky?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kitu kuwa angani?

ExampleWords.AUni: aloft, up in the sky, up in the air,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the sun. The sun does three basic things. It moves, it gives light, and it gives heat. These three actions are involved in the meanings of most of the words in this domain. Since the sun moves below the horizon, many words refer to it setting or rising. Since the sun is above the clouds, many words refer to it moving behind the clouds and the clouds blocking its light. The sun's light and heat also produce secondary effects. The sun causes plants to grow, and it causes damage to things.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na jua. Jua lina kazi tatu hasa: linatembea, linatoa mwanga, na linatoa joto.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the sun?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sun, solar, sol, daystar, our star

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to how the sun moves?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi jua linavyotembea?

ExampleWords.AUni: rise, set, cross the sky, come up, go down, sink

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time when the sun rises?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja wakati jua linapochomoza?

AStr.Run: We got up before <dawn>, in order to get an early start.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the time when the sun is at its highest point?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja wakati jua linapofika juu kabisa angani?
(5) What words refer to the time when the sun sets?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja wakati jua linapotua?
(6) What words refer to when the sun is shining?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja wakati jua linawaka?

ExampleWords.AUni: shine, sunny, bright, give light, be sunshiny, daytime,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the sun shining through the clouds?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja mng'ao wa jua ukipita mawingu?

ExampleWords.AUni: come out, break through (the clouds), go behind (a cloud)

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe where the sun is shining?
(8) Maneno gani hueleza mahali jua linapong'aa?

ExampleWords.AUni: sunlit, be (out) in the sun, lit by the sun, shine on, be in the sunlight, sunny (spot)

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe when or where the sun doesn't shine?
(9) Maneno gani hueleza wakati na mahali jua lisipowaka?

ExampleWords.AUni: shade, eclipse of the sun, sunless, shady, shadow, eclipse (v),
hali ya mawingu, kivuli, kupatwa jua

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to the light of the sun?
(10) Maneno gani hutaja nuru ya jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sunlight, ray, sunshine, beam, light, sunbeam, radiance, glow, sparkle, glisten, glare
nuru, mwanga wa jua, mionzi wa jua, kianga, mwangaza

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe the brightness of the sun?
(11) Maneno gani hueleza mng'ao wa jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: bright, intense, brilliant, blinding, glaring, glistening, luminous, dim
jua kali, mng'ao, mng'arizo, kung'aa, kumeremeta

Question.AUni: (12) What refer to the sun heating things?
(12) Maneno gani hutaja jua likipashia moto vitu?
(13) What else does the sun do?
(13) Kuna matendo mengine linayoyafanya jua?
(14) What words describe the damage done by sunlight?
(14) Maneno gani hueleza madhara yanayofanywa na jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sunburn, sunstroke, suntan, tan, heatstroke, heat prostration, sun damage, fading from the sun, bleached by the sun
mbabuko wa jua, ugonjwa kutokana na jua kali

Question.AUni: (15) What do people use to protect themselves from the sun?
(15) Watu hutumia nini ili kujilinda na jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sunglasses, shade tree, suntan lotion, awning, sun umbrella, parasol, sunbonnet, hat, visor
miwani ya jua, mwamvuli wa jua, kivuli cha mti

Question.AUni: (16) What words are used of telling time by the sun?
(16) Maneno gani yanatumika kuelezea wakati kwa kutumia jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sundial, angle of the sun, sun-clock, shoot the sun, position of the sun,
saa ya kivuli, kuelekea jua, kujua wakati kwa kutazama jua lilipo

Question.AUni: (17) What words refer to using the power of the sun?
(17) Maneno gani hutaja kutumia nguvu ya jua?

ExampleWords.AUni: solar energy, solar power, solar panel
nishati ya mionzi ya jua, sola

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the moon. In your culture people may believe things about the moon. For instance in European culture people used to believe that the moon caused people to become crazy. So in English we have words like "moon-struck" and "lunatic." You should include such words in this domain.
Tumia eneo hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na mwezi.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the moon?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mwezi?
(2) What words refer to how the moon moves?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi mwezi unavyotembea?
(3) What words refer to the time when the moon rises?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja wakati mwezi unapotokeza?
(4) What words refer to the time when the moon sets?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja wakati mwezi unapotua?
(5) What words refer to when the moon is shining?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja wakati mwezi unapoangaza?

ExampleWords.AUni: moon is shining, by the light of the moon, moon is/comes out,

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe where the moon is shining?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea mahali mwezi unakoangaza?

ExampleWords.AUni: moonlit, be in the moonlight, lit by the moon, shine on,

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe when or where the moon doesn't shine?
(7) Maneno gani huelezea wakati au mahali ambapo mwezi huangazi?

ExampleWords.AUni: moonless night, eclipse of the moon, eclipse (v),
kupatwa mwezi, usiku usio na mwezi, usiku wa giza

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to the light of the moon?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja nuru ya mwezi?

ExampleWords.AUni: mbalamwezi, mng'ao wa mwezi, mwali wa mwezi

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe the brightness of the moon?
(9) Maneno gani huelezea mng'ao wa mwezi?
(10) What words describe the appearance of the moon?
(10) Maneno gani huelezea sura ya mwezi (k.m., kuna mtu au mnyama inayoonekana katika sura ya mwezi)?

ExampleWords.AUni: man in the moon, harvest moon

Question.AUni: (11) What words refer to the spots on the moon?
(11) Maneno gani hutaja madoa mwezini?
(12) What words refer to the phases of the moon?
(12) Maneno gani yanataja mabadiliko ya sura ya mwezi?

ExampleWords.AUni: phase, new moon, full moon, half moon, quarter moon, crescent, sliver, moon is waxing (getting bigger), moon is waning (getting smaller), wax and wane
mwezi mpya, mwandamo, mwezi mzima, mwezi-nusu, mwezi-robo, mwezi mpevu, kufifia kwa mwezi, kupevuka kwa mwezi, kuongezeka kwa mwezi

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to the time it takes for the moon to go through its phases?
(13) Maneno gani hutaja wakati wa kupita kwa mabadiliko yote kwa mwezi?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the stars and other heavenly bodies.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na nyota.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to the stars?
(1) Maneno gani hutumika kutaja nyota kwa jumla?
(2) What words describe the sky when the stars are shining?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea anga wakati nyota zinaangaza?

ExampleWords.AUni: starlit (sky), (sky is) ablaze with stars, starry (sky), star studded (sky), stars are shining

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used for where the stars are shining?
(3) Maneno gani hutumika mahali nyota zinapong'aa?
(4) What words are used for when or where the stars don't shine?
(4) Maneno gani yanatumika wakati au mahali ambapo nyota hazing'ai?
(5) What words refer to the light of the stars?
(5) Maneno yapi hutaja nuru ya nyota?
(6) What words describe the brightness of the stars?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea mwangaza wa nyota?
(7) What words describe the appearance of the stars?
(7) Maneno gani huelezea sura ya nyota?
(8) What words refer to the study of the stars?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja masomo au utafiti wa nyota?

ExampleWords.AUni: astronomy, astronomer, astrology, astrologer, stargazer, magi

Question.AUni: (9) What is a group of stars called?
(9) Kundi la nyota linaitwaje?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to planets (large objects that circle the sun, looking like bright wandering stars in the sky), comets (objects that circle the sun, looking like a star with a tail), meteors (small objects that come from space and burn up when they hit the earth's atmosphere, causing a streak of light across the sky), and asteroids (small objects that circle the sun), planetary moons (large objects that circle the planets). Some cultures do not study the stars and will have few or no words in this domain. Others cultures that study the stars will have many words. There are only five planets that people can see in the sky--Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. The others are only known from the scientific study of astronomy.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na sayari (yaani kitu katika anga ambacho huzunguka jua kama dunia yetu au nyota ya alfajiri), vimondo, na vitu vingine katika anga.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a planet?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja sayari?
(2) What are the names of the planets?
(2) Majina ya sayari ni nini?

ExampleWords.AUni: Mercury, Venus (Morning Star, Evening Star), Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto
Zebaki, Zuhura (nyota ya alfajiri), Dunia, Mars, Mshtarii (Jupita), Zohali (Zahari), Uranus, Neptuni, Pluto

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to how the planets move?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi sayari, nyota au vimondo vinavyotembea?
(4) What words refer to the sun and planets?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja mfumo wa jua na sayari zake pamoja?
(5) What words refer to comets?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kimondo kinachopita mbali tu?
(6) What do comets do?
(6) Vimondo hivyo vinafanya nini?
(7) What words refer to meteors?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja kimondo kinachogonga anga la dunia?

ExampleWords.AUni: meteor, shooting star, falling star, meteor trail, meteor shower

Question.AUni: (8) What do meteors do?
(8) Vimondo vya kugonga anga vinafanya nini?

ExampleWords.AUni: flash across the sky, blaze a trail across the sky, strike the earth, make a crater, burn up
kumulika kwa kukatiza anga, kufanya mlipuko, kuacha mburuzo

Question.AUni: (9) What words are used for when a meteor hits the earth?
(9) Maneno gani yanatumika wakati kimondo kinagonga dunia?

ExampleWords.AUni: jiwe lililotoka katika nyota, mlipuko wa kimondo, kreta ya kimondo

Question.AUni: (10) What is a small planet called?
(10) Sayari ndogo inaitwaje?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the air around us, including the air we breathe and the atmosphere around the earth.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hewa inayotuzunguka, pamoja na hewa tunayoipumua na angahewa inayozunguka dunia yetu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the air we breathe?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hewa tunayoipumua?
(2) What words refer to how much water is in the air?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi cha maji yaliyomo hewani?

ExampleWords.AUni: humid, humidity, damp, dry, sticky, muggy

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe good air (such as when the air in a room is clean or doesn't smell bad)?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea hewa njema (kama hewa ndani ya nyumba ikiwa ni safi au isiponuka vibaya)?
(4) What words describe bad air (such as when the air in a room is dirty, hot, smells bad, or too many people are breathing)?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea hewa mbaya (kama hewa ndani ya nyumba ikiwa ni chafu, yenye joto, ikinuka vibaya au ikiwa kuna mpumuo wa watu wengi mno)?

ExampleWords.AUni: stuffy, airless, stifling, polluted, air pollution, smog

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to causing air to move.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kusogeza au kupuliza hewa.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to causing air to move?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kusogeza au kupuliza hewa?
(2) What words refer to letting air blow through something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kuacha hewa ipitie kwenye kitu fulani?
(3) What words refer to putting air into something (such as a tire or balloon)?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja kujaza upepo kwenye kitu (kama vile tairi au puto)?

ExampleWords.AUni: blow up, inflate, pump up, pneumatic

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to keeping air out of something?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja kuzuia hewa isiingie ndani ya kitu fulani?
(5) What words refer to how much air is in something?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi cha hewa iliyomo ndani ya kitu?
(6) What words refer to using the wind to winnow grain?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kutumia hewa ili kupepeta?
(7) What tools and machines are used to create or use the wind?
(7) Vifaa na mitambo gani hutumika kutengeneza upepo au kutumia nguvu zake?

ExampleWords.AUni: fan, air pump, bellows, ventilator, wind tunnel, propeller, air pipe, airshaft, vent, chimney, exhaust, funnel, windmill, sail, valve

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the weather.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya hewa.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the weather?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya hewa?
(2) What words describe the weather when it is good?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa ni nzuri?

ExampleWords.AUni: sunny, sunshine, clear (weather), good (weather), fair (weather), fine (day)
hali ya hewa ni nzuri, ni safi, ni njema, kumetakata

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe the weather when it is getting better?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa imeanza kubadilika kuwa nzuri?

ExampleWords.AUni: clear, clear up, sun comes out,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe the weather when it is bad?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa ni mbaya?

ExampleWords.AUni: bad, terrible, foul, inclement, rough, dirty sky, severe
hali ya hewa ni mbaya, inachukiza

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe the weather when it is getting worse?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa imeanza kubadilika kuwa mbaya?
(6) What words describe the weather when it changes?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa inapobadilika?
(7) What words describe the weather when it stays the same?
(7) Maneno gani huelezea wakati hali ya hewa haijabadilika?
(8) What words are used to describe any kind of weather?
(8) Maneno gani hutumika kuelezea aina zote za hali ya hewa?

ExampleWords.AUni: rain or shine, all weather, in all weathers

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe the temperature?
(9) Maneno gani hulezea hali ya joto au baridi?

ExampleWords.AUni: temperature, hot, warm, heat, cold, chilly, crisp, mild, unseasonably warm/cold, scorching, heat wave, cold spell, cold snap, frigid, freezing, be a chill in the air,
joto, baridi, hali ya jua kali, unyevunyevu

Question.AUni: (10) What words describe the weather when there is a lot of water in the air?
(10) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya hewa wakati maji mengi yamo hewani?
(11) What words refer to the type of weather a place normally has?
(11) Maneno gani hutaja aina ya hali ya hewa iliyopo mahali fulani kwa kawaida?

ExampleWords.AUni: tabia za hewa, hali ya ukavu, hali ya unyevunyevu

Question.AUni: (12) What words describe something that has been exposed to the weather for a long time?
(12) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho kimekaa nje kwenye hali ya hewa kwa muda mrefu?
(13) What words refer to studying the weather?
(13) Maneno gani hutaja masomo au utafiti wa hali ya hewa?
(14) What instruments are used to study the weather?
(14) Vifaa gani hutumika kwa masomo au utafiti wa hali ya hewa?
(15) What words refer to a report about the weather?
(15) Maneno gani hutaja taarifa au ripoti kuhusu hali ya hewa?

ExampleWords.AUni: weather forecast, weather report, the weather, the outlook

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the wind. Some words refer to when the wind begins and ends. The wind changes in speed, so some words refer to how fast the wind is moving. Try to rank these on a scale from very slow to very fast. These words may also be distinguished by what the wind does, since a fast wind does more things. These words may also be distinguished by how long the wind blows. Some words refer to the speed of the wind becoming faster or slower. Some words distinguish a steady wind from a wind in which the speed keeps changing. Some words refer to when the speed of the wind becomes faster for a short time. A steady wind moves in a particular direction, so there are words that include the direction of the wind. The direction of the wind may refer to the points of the compass, a neighboring geographical feature or area, or the direction in which the speaker is moving. Some words refer to a wind that moves in a small circle, making a pillar of dust or a funnel-shaped cloud. Some words refer to what the wind does, such as when it moves or damages something. People can feel the wind, so some words refer to how it feels. The wind makes noise, so there are words that refer to the sound of the wind. In some cultures there is a relation between the wind and spirits, so some words may refer to the activity of the spirits in the wind, or that the wind brings disease.
Tumia eneo la maana hili ili kupata maneno yanayohusiana na upepo uvumao tu.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the wind?
(1) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja upepo uvumao?

ExampleWords.AUni: upepo, hali ya upepo mwingi, mkondo wa upepo

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe a wind that only lasts a short time?
Maneno gani huelezea upepo ambao huvuma kwa muda mfupi tu?

ExampleWords.AUni: breath of air, puff of wind, gust, blast, flurry

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a steady wind?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea upepo wenye nguvu usiobadilika?

ExampleWords.AUni: steady wind, trade wind, monsoon winds

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a wind that comes and goes?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea upepo unaokuja na kupita?
(5) What words describe a strong wind?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea upepo wenye nguvu?

ExampleWords.AUni: heavy wind, strong wind, squall, gale, stormy wind, howling wind
tufani, dhoruba, mvumo, upepo mkali, upepo wenye kishindo

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe a light wind?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea upepo mwepesi?

ExampleWords.AUni: light wind, gentle wind, draft, draught, breeze, breezy, zephyr

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe a windstorm?
Maneno gani huelezea dhoruba ya upepo?
(8) What words refer to a wind that moves in a circle?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja upepo unaozunguka zunguka?

ExampleWords.AUni: whirlwind, tornado, twister, dust devil, funnel, waterspout

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to a warm or cold wind?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja upepo ambao ni joto au baridi?
(10) What words describe when the wind begins?
(10) Maneno gani huelezea wakati upepo unapoanza kuvuma?

ExampleWords.AUni: pick up, rise, freshen, gather, blow up

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe when the wind stops?
(11) Maneno gani huelezea wakati upepo unapoacha kuvuma?
(12) What words describe the direction of the wind?
(12) Maneno gani huelezea mwelekeo wa upepo?

ExampleWords.AUni: north/south/east/west wind, northeaster, wind off the ocean, ocean breeze, wind from the mountains, mountain breeze, wind from the desert, updraft, downdraft, head wind, tail wind, following wind, cross breeze, windward, lee, prevailing
kaskazi, kusi, upepo wa mashariki, upepo wa demani

Question.AUni: (13) What does the wind do?
(13) Upepo hufanya nini?

ExampleWords.AUni: blow, knock down (things), rip, tear off, bend, puff out, billow out (sail), push (boat), raise (waves), fan flames, push snow into drifts, ventilate a house
kuvuma, kusambaza vumbi, kuinua mawimbi, kuburudisha, kugongesha vitu, kusukuma mashua, kuangusha, kuleta hewa safi nyumbani

Question.AUni: (14) What words describe something being blown by the wind?
(14) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho kimepeperushwa na upepo?

ExampleWords.AUni: be blown by the wind, wind blows something, blow away, waft on the breeze, flutter in the breeze, be carried by the wind, be born along on/by the wind, be picked up by the wind
kurushwa katika upepo, kubebwa na upepo, kuotokwa na upepo

Question.AUni: (15) What instruments are used to measure the direction or force of the wind?
(15) Vifaa gani hutumika kupima mwelekeo au nguvu ya upepo?

ExampleWords.AUni: kieleleza upepo, pepeo la hali ya hewa, mfuko ulioning'inizwa juu ya mlingoti

Question.AUni: (16) What sounds does the wind make?
(16) Upepo hufanya sauti gani?

ExampleWords.AUni: whisper, sigh, moan, whistle, howl, scream, shriek
kuvuma, kupumua, kulia, kupiga kite, kupiga mluzi, kunong'ona, yowe nyembamba

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the clouds.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na mawingu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a cloud?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja wingu?
(2) What do clouds do?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for all plants. Use a book of pictures to identify plant names and the scientific name. Languages divide plants into various domains that are not always comparable from language to language. Criterial features may be characteristics (trees and bushes are distinguished by size and number of trunks) and use (grass and weeds are distinguished by their desirability). A common distinction is between trees and non-trees, with trees described as being big, woody, and having a life expectancy of several years, while non-trees are small, non-woody, and have a life expectancy of typically not more than one year (Heine, Bernd and Karsten Legere. 1995. Swahili plants. Rudiger Koppe Verlag: Koln.). Agricultural societies will divide plants into wild and cultivated. However most plants for which there are names have some use. Therefore it does not seem helpful to divide plant names into domains for useful and non-useful plants. Since only parts of plants are eaten, edible parts of plants are listed under the domain 'Food'. Some languages may have more domains than are used in this list, others may have fewer. The classification system used here does not agree entirely with the system used by botanists. For instance botanists do not classify all the tree species together. The palm trees belong to the class Monocotyledoneae and are classified with lilies, bananas, and orchids. Apple and cherry trees belong to the class Dicotyledoneae and are classified in the rose family along with roses and blackberries. The acacia tree also belongs to the class Dicotyledoneae and is classified in the pulse family along with lupines and beans. However most folk taxonomies bring all the trees together. The scientific classification system for plants and animals is taken from: Carruth, Gorton, ed. 1989. The Volume Library, Vols. 1 and 2. The Southwestern Company: Nashville.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja mimea yote. Tumia kitabu chenye picha kwa ajili ya kutambua kila aina pamoja na jina lake la kisayansi.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for trees--flowering plants with roots, stems, and leaves, which are large and have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the evergreen trees (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Gymnospermae). Evergreen trees do not have flowers, but have cone like fruits (pinecones) that contain seeds. Their leaves are shaped like needles and are retained for over a year.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for small plants that have roots, stems, flowers, and seeds, but do not have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the seedless plants, such as ferns (phylum Pteridophyta, class Felicineae), horsetails (phylum Pteridophyta, class Equisetineae), and club mosses (phylum Pteridophyta, class Lycopodineae). Plants of the Pteridophyta phylum have no flowers or seeds. Ferns have large, divided, feather-like leaves, or fronds. Club mosses are small (rarely over one meter) evergreen plants with simple leaves resembling pine or hemlock needles. Sometimes they grow upright, but often trail on the ground, where they propagate by means of runners. Horsetails send up tall, vertical, jointed stalks with branches covered with scale like leaves.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja mimea midogo yenye mizizi, maua na mbegu, lakini haina shina la mbao--yaani mimea yenye matawi yanayotambaa tu.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for mosses (phylum Bryophyta, class Musci), liverworts (phylum Bryophyta, class Hepaticae), fungi (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Fungi), algae (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Algae), and lichens. These plants do not have true roots, stems, or leaves. The mosses are small, green, flowerless plants that grow in moist environments and look like velvety or feathery growths carpeting the ground, tree trunks, and rocks. The liverworts are similar to the mosses with a flat and branching growth pattern. The algae possess green chlorophyll. They vary from one-celled organisms, which sometimes live in colonies such as pond scum, to complex organisms such as seaweed. The fungi do not possess chlorophyll and feed off of other organic material. Lichens consist of a fungus and an algae growing together. They commonly grow on trunks of trees and rocks. Some are flat and leafy, and some are moss like.
Tunia eneo la maana hili kwa mimea yote isiyo sawa katika eneo lingine.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to parts of a plant. Start with general words that all plants have. Then think through each major type of plant. Finish by thinking of specific plants that are well known (usually cultivated crops) and that have words for specific parts (e.g. tassel on a corn/maize cob).

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayorejea katika sehemu za mmea. Anza na maneno ya kawaida kwa sehemu zilizoko katika kila mmea. Endelea na sehemu za kila aina ya mmea (mti, mti mfupi, mitishamba, majani n.k.). Mwishoni, fikiria mimea inayojulikana vizuri (kwa kawaida ni mimea inayolimwa) na taja sehemu zake maalum (k.m. ndevu za mahindi).

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing types of animals. Use a book of pictures to identify each species and its scientific name. This section is organized according to the scientific, biological classification of animals. It may not correspond to the local classification of animals (folk taxonomy), which are often based on how people relate to animals (tame/wild, edible/work). Use this domain for words referring to large classes of animals that do not correspond to the scientific classification. For instance this would be the place for a word like 'flying animal', which includes birds, bats, and flying insects.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea aina za wanyama. Tumia kitabu chenye picha kwa ajili ya kutambua kila aina pamoja na jina lake la kisayansi.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the names of insect species (phylum Arthropoda, class Insecta). Note that insects have six legs and spiders have eight legs. However some languages may not distinguish insects from spiders and may use other characteristics to sub-divide the Arthropods.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja vitendo vya wanyama.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the ability of an animal to do something without learning it?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja uwezo wa mnyama kufanya jambo bila kujifunza jinsi ya kufanya?
(2) What words refer to animals hunting?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja wanyama wanapowinda wanyama wengine?
(3) What words refer to animals sleeping during the winter?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja wanyama wanapolala wakati wa msimu mzima wa baridi?
(4) What do birds do?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja vitendo vya ndege?
(5) What do snakes do?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja vitendo vya nyoka?
(6) What do fish do?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja vitendo vya samaki?
(7) What do insects do?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja vitendo vya wadudu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for ways in which animals move. Only include words specific for the movement of animals. For the movement of people use the domains under Movement. It is necessary to think through how each type of animal moves, especially the important ones.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja mwendo wa wanyama tu. Fikiria kila aina ya mnyama na anavyosogea. Kwa maneno yanayotaja mwendo wa watu, tumia eneo lake (7.2 kusogea).

Question.AUni: (1) How do mammals move?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa mamalia?

ExampleWords.AUni: gallop, trot, hop, crawl, fly, soar
kuenda shoti, kuenda matiti, kuruka, kutambaa

Question.AUni: (2) How do cows move?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa ng'ombe?

ExampleWords.AUni: walk, trot, wander, lie down, charge

Question.AUni: (3) How do dogs move?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa mbwa?
(4) How do horses move?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa farasi?

ExampleWords.AUni: run, gallop, trot, canter, buck, kick, race, charge

Question.AUni: (5) How do lions move?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa simba?

ExampleWords.AUni: walk, stalk, charge, run down, prowl

Question.AUni: (6) How do whales move?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa nyangumi?
(7) How do birds move?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa ndege?

ExampleWords.AUni: fly, flutter, soar, dive, swoop, bank, turn, (hummingbird) hover, hop, roost, hang in the air, ride the wind, alight, land

Question.AUni: (8) How do snakes move?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa nyoka?
(9) How do fish move?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa samaki?
(10) How do insects move?
(10) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa wadudu?
(11) How do worms move?
(11) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa minyoo?
(12) What words refer to the annual migration of animals?
(12) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa wanyama wa kila mwaka?
(13) What words refer to animals moving in a group?
(13) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa wanyama katika kundi?

ExampleWords.AUni: herd (v), flock (v), swarm (v), herd instinct, fly in formation, move as a herd,

Question.AUni: (14) What words refer to animal tracks?
(14) Maneno gani hutaja nyayo za mnyama?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to animals eating. Because animals often eat in very different ways from people, many languages will have words that are specific to the way an animal eats.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja wanyama walavyo. Kwa sababu wanyama wanakula kwa namna tofauti kuliko watu, lugha zingine zitakuwa na maneno maalumu kwa jinsi mnyama anavyokula.

Question.AUni: (1) How do mammals eat?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi wanavyokula mamalia?
(2) How do carnivores eat?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi wanavyokula wanyama walacho nyama?
(3) How do birds eat?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi ndege wanavyokula?
(4) How do snakes eat?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi nyoka wanavyokula?
(5) How do insects eat?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi wadudu wanavyokula?

ExampleWords.AUni: suck blood, bloodsucking, chew (holes in leaves)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the sounds animals make. It is necessary to think through the sounds each type of animal makes, especially the important ones.
Tumia eneo la maana hili ili kupata maneno yanayoelezea sauti ya wanyama. Fikiria kila aina ya mnyama na sauti yake.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the sounds of animals?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja sauti za mnyama kwa jumla?
(2) What sounds do cows make?
(2) Ng'ombe wanatoa sauti gani?
(3) What sounds do horses make?
(3) Farasi wanatoa sauti gani?
(4) What sounds do sheep make?
(4) Kondoo wanatoa sauti gani?
(5) What sounds do pigs make?
(5) Nguruwe wanatoa sauti gani?
(6) What sounds do dogs make?
(6) Mbwa wanatoa sauti gani?

ExampleWords.AUni: bark, bay, howl, yap, growl, snap, snarl, whimper, whine, woof woof, yelp, yowl,

Question.AUni: (7) What sounds do cats make?
(7) Paka wanatoa sauti gani?
(8) What sounds do lions make?
(8) Simba wanatoa sauti gani?
(9) What sounds do mice make?
(10) Panya wanatoa sauti gani?
(10) What sounds do birds make?
(10) Ndege wanatoa sauti gani?

ExampleWords.AUni: sing, song, cry, call, birdcall, birdsong, caw (crow), chatter, cheep, chirp, coo (dove), gaggle, gobble (turkey), honk (goose), hoot (owl), peep, quack (duck), screech, squawk, trill, trumpet, tweet, twitter, warble, whir, whistle,
kulia kama bundi, mlio mwembamba, kuimba, kupiga mluzi

Question.AUni: (11) What sounds do chickens make?
(11) Kuku wanatoa sauti gani?

ExampleWords.AUni: cackle, cluck, crow, cockle doodle doo

Question.AUni: (12) What sounds do snakes make?
(12) Nyoka wanatoa sauti gani?
(13) What noises do frogs make?
(13) Chura wanatoa sauti gani?
(14) What sounds do crocodiles make?
(14) Mamba wanatoa sauti gani?
(15) What sounds do fish make?
(15) Samaki wanatoa sauti gani?
(16) What sounds do insects make?
(16) Wadudu wanatoa sauti gani?

ExampleWords.AUni: buzz, chirp, chirr, drone, whine, gnaw

AStr.Run: Use this domain for animal homes. It is necessary to think through the homes of each type of animal, especially the important ones.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja maskani ya wanyama tu. Fikiria kila aina ya wanyama na maskani yao. Kwa maneno yanayotaja maskani ya wanyama yaliyojengwa na watu, tumia eneo la maana lake 6.3 (ufugaji).

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to where an animal lives?
(1) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja mahali anapoishi mnyama?
(2) Where do mammals live?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja mahali wanapoishi mamalia?
(3) What other places do mammals use?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja mahali pengine ambapo mamalia hufika?

ExampleWords.AUni: wallow, hunting grounds, watering hole, pasture, range, trail
magaagao ya wanyama, dimbwi wanaponywea wanyama

Question.AUni: (4) Where do birds live?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja mahali wanapoishi ndege?
(5) Where do snakes live?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja maskani ya nyoka?

ExampleWords.AUni: snake pit, den of vipers, snake hole

Question.AUni: (6) Where do fish live (other than water, lake, and ocean)?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja maskani ya samaki (nje ya maji, ziwa na bahari)?
(7) Where do insects live?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja maskani ya wadudu?

ExampleWords.AUni: anthill, ants nest, termite mound, termite hill, hive, beehive, bee's wax, honeycomb, spider web, cocoon, trail (of ants)
kichuguu, mzinga, kifukofuko, nta ya nyuki, masega

Question.AUni: (8) Where do spiders live?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja maskani ya buibui?

ExampleWords.AUni: kimia cha buibui, utando wa buibui

Question.AUni: (9) Where do worms live?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja maskani ya minyoo?

ExampleWords.AUni: tobo la funza, kitundu cha mnyoo

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to groups of animals.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja makundi ya wanyama tu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a group of mammals?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la mamalia fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: herd (of cattle), drove (of cattle), kennel (of dogs), pack (of dogs), pride (of lions), pod (of whales)
kundi (la ng'ombe, kondoo, mbuzi, simba au nyangumi), genge (la mbwa)

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a group of birds?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la ndege?

ExampleWords.AUni: flock (of birds), bevy, colony, covey, flight, flock, gaggle

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group of fish?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la samaki?
(4) What is a group of insects called?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la wadudu?

ExampleWords.AUni: bumba (la nyuki), kundi (la nzi), baa (la nzige)

Question.AUni: (5) What is a group of small animals called?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la wanyama wadogo?
(6) What words refer to the leader of a group of animals?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja kiongozi wa kundi la wanyama?
(7) What words refer to the followers in a group of animals?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja wafuasi katika kundi la wanyama?
(8) What words refer to a group of baby animals?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja kundi la wanyama ambao bado wananyonya au bado hawajakua?

ExampleWords.AUni: brood, clutch (of eggs), kit, litter (of kittens), farrow (of pigs)

Question.AUni: (9) What other words relate to groups of animals?
(9) Maneno gani mengine yanahusiana na makundi ya wanyama?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to male and female animals. Most languages have special words for the male and female of a species only for domesticated animals. Sometimes there will be a word for the male and not the female, and vice versa (male dog, bitch). Sometimes the word for one is also used generically (cow for both female and generic).

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja wanyama dume na jike. Lugha zingine zina maneno maalumu kwa dume na jike ya aina fulani ya mnyama afugwaye. Pengine kutakuwa na neno kwa dume na si kwa jike ya aina fulani ya mnyama na pengine itakuwa kinyume.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a male or female animal?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mnyama dume au jike (yaani kuna aina gani za wanyama dume na jike)?

ExampleWords.AUni: male, female, bitch, tom, tomcat, bull, bullock, cow, heifer, ram, ewe, billy goat, nanny goat, boar, sow, stallion, mare, filly, stag, buck, hart, doe, vixen, lioness, tigress, bull elephant, rooster, cock, hen, drake, peacock, peahen

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to nature and the environment--the world around us. Include words that refer to how people damage or protect nature.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja vitu vya asili na mazingira--yaani ulimwengu unaotuzunguka. Fikiria maneno yanayotaja jinsi watu wanavyoharibu au kuhifadhi vitu vya asili.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the world around us?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja ulimwengu unaotuzunguka?
(2) What words refer to damaging the environment?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuharibu mazingira?

ExampleWords.AUni: pollute, pollution, pollutant, acid rain, smog, deforestation, global warming, greenhouse effect

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to protecting the environment?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuhifadhi mazingira?
(4) What words refer to the study of the environment?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja masomo au utafiti wa mazingira?
(5) What words refer to a person who studies or tries to protect the environment?
(5) Maneno gani humtaja mtu anayesoma au kujaribu kuhifadhi mazingira?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is natural--something in the world around us, as opposed to something that has been made or changed by people.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea kitu ambacho ni cha asili--yaani kitu kilichoumbwa na Mungu na si kitu ambacho kimetengenezwa au kubadilishwa na watu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is natural?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho ni cha asili?

ExampleWords.AUni: natural, naturally, wild (animals, country), raw (materials), virgin (forest), untamed, organic

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for a person or all mankind.
Tumia eneo la maana hili ili kupata maneno ya kawaida yanayohusiana na mtu au binadamu kwa jumla.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a single member of the human race?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mtu mmoja wa binadamu?

ExampleWords.AUni: person, human being, man, individual, figure

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person when you aren't sure who the person is?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja mtu ikiwa hauna hakika mtu huyo ni nani?
(3) What words refer to more than one person?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja mtu zaidi ya mmoja?

ExampleWords.AUni: people, folks, population, the public, populace,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the entire human race?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja watu wote wa binadamu?

ExampleWords.AUni: man, men, mankind, the human race, humanity, humankind,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe something characteristic of all people?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea utu wa wanadamu wote?
(6) What words describe something characteristic of one person?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea utu wa mwanadamu mmoja?
(7) What words refer to no person?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna mtu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for the whole human body, and general words for any part of the body. Use a drawing or photo to label each part. Some words may be more general than others are and include some of the other words. For instance 'head' is more general than 'face' or 'nose'. Be sure that both general and specific parts are labeled.

Tumia eneo la maana hili ili kupata maneno ya kawaida yanayotaja mwili mzima na sehemu za jumla. Angalia mchoro wa mwili na kuandikia kila sehemu. Maneno fulani yataleta maana pana zaidi kuliko mengine. Hakikisha kuingiza maneno ya jumla na maalumu yote.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the body?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mwili?
(2) What words refer to the shape of a person's body?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja umbo la mwili wa mtu?
(3) What general words refer to a part of the body?
(3) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja sehemu ya mwili kwa jumla?

ExampleWords.AUni: part of the body, body part, anatomy, appendage, member, orifice,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something about your body?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kuhusu mwili wa mtu?
(5) What words refer to cells?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja chembe hai?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the parts of the head.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja sehemu za kichwa tu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the head?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kichwa?
(2) What are the parts of the head?
(2) Sehemu za kichwa zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: feature, scalp, back of the head, chin, temple, poll, skull, brain,
uso, panda la uso, kidevu, ngozi ya kichwa pamoja na nywele zake, kikosi

Question.AUni: (3) What are the parts of the face?
(3) Sehemu za uso zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: face, forehead, cheek, chin, cleft (in chin), dimple (in cheek), jaw,
uso, panda la uso, kidevu, taya, shavu

Question.AUni: (4) What are the parts of the neck?
(4) Sehemu za shingo zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: neck, nape (back of the neck), throat, Adam's apple, wrinkle, fold in skin of neck

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe the parts of a person's face?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea sura ya sehemu za uso wa mtu?

ExampleWords.AUni: facial, thin (face), high (forehead), thick (eyebrows), long (eyelashes), beady (eyes), stubby (nose), fleshy (cheeks), narrow (mouth), double chin
panda ndefu, macho madogo, macho ya mviringo, pua fupi

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the eye.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na jicho.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an eye?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja jicho?
(2) What are the parts of the eye?
(2) Sehemu za jicho zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: eyebrow, brow, eyelash, lash, eyelid, lid, pupil, cornea, iris, white, eyeball, ball of the eye, corner of the eye, tear duct, retina, eye socket,
jicho, mboni ya jicho, nyusi, ukope, vigubiko, tundu la kishimo cha jicho, kichirizi cha machozi

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a person's eyes?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya macho ya mtu?

ExampleWords.AUni: bloodshot, bleary, bleary-eyed, beady eyes, thick (eyebrows), long (eyelashes), blue-eyed, cross-eyed,

Question.AUni: (4) What do the eyes do?
(4) Macho yana kazi gani?
(5) What words refer to the eyes moving?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kuenenda kwa macho?

ExampleWords.AUni: look cross-eyed, roll, flicker, raise, lower, glaze,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the eyelids moving?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja kuenenda kwa kope?

ExampleWords.AUni: blink, wink, close, open, squint, open wide (in amazement), bat (eyelids), flutter,

Question.AUni: (7) What do people do to their eyes?
(7) Watu hufanyia nini macho yao?
(8) What do the eyes produce?
(8) Macho huzalisha au hutoa nini?
(9) What words refer to the material that collects in the corner of the eyes while sleeping?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja utoaji wa macho wakati wa kulala usingizi?
(10) What words refer to the pupil of the eye getting bigger or smaller?
(10) Maneno gani hutaja mboni ya jicho kuwa kubwa au dogo?
(11) What words describe something to do with the eyes?
(11) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachohusiana na macho?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the ear.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na masikio.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an ear?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja sikio?
(2) What are the parts of the ear?
(2) Sehemu za sikio zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: earlobe, lobe, inner ear, eardrum, tympanum, Eustachian tube, auditory nerve, canal, cochlea,
sikio, kiwambo cha sikio, ndewe, nta za masikio

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a person's ears?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya masikio ya mtu?
(4) What do the ears do?
(4) Masikio yana kazi gani?
(5) What words refer to the ears moving?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kuenenda kwa masikio?
(6) What do people do to their ears?
(6) Watu hufanyia nini masikio yao?

ExampleWords.AUni: scratch, pick (your ear), clean, cup (put hand behind to help hearing), pierce (for earrings),

Question.AUni: (7) What do people do to their ears so they won't hear something?
(7) Watu hufanyia nini masikio yao ili wasisikie kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: plug your ears, cover your ears, stuff cotton in your ears, stick your fingers in your ears, earplugs

Question.AUni: (8) What do the ears produce?
(8) Masikio huzalisha au hutoa nini?
(9) What do people use to clean their ears?
(9) Watu hutumia nini ili wasafishe masikio?
(10) What words describe something to do with the ears?
(10) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachohusiana na macho?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the nose.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na pua.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the nose?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja pua?
(2) What are the parts of the nose?
(2) Sehemu za pua zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: nostril, bridge, septum, sinus, nasal passage, mucous membrane,
pua, mianzi ya pua, tundu ya pua

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a person's nose?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya pua ya mtu?

ExampleWords.AUni: pointed, flat, turned-up, snub-nosed, stubby, wide, long, upturned, hooked, aquiline,

Question.AUni: (4) What does the nose do?
(4) Pua ina kazi gani?
(5) What words describe the way air moves through the nose?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea jinsi hewa inavyopitia kwenye pua?

ExampleWords.AUni: sneeze, sniff, sniffle, snort, snuffle, wheeze
kunusanusa, kuvuta puani, kukoroma, kutoa pumzi puani, kupiga

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the nose moving?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja kuenenda kwa pua?
(7) What do people do to their nose?
(7) Watu hufanyia nini pua yao?

ExampleWords.AUni: hold your nose, pierce (the septum), put a ring in (the nose)
kutoboa (kwa ajili ya hazama, yaani heleni ya pua), kusemea puani

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe something to do with the nose?
(8) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachohusiana na pua?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the mouth. Do not use this domain for words referring to eating, drinking, or speaking.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na mdomo. Usitumie eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja matendo ya kula, kunywa au kusema.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the mouth?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja mdomo?
(2) What are the parts of the mouth?
(2) Sehemu za mdomo zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: lip, tongue, tooth, gum, uvula, palate, alveolar ridge, mouth cavity, roof, velum, throat,
mdomo, midomo, mdomo wa juu, mdomo wa chini, ulimi, jino, ufizi, kaakaa gumu, kaakaa laini, kilimi

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a person's mouth?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya mdomo wa mtu?

ExampleWords.AUni: narrow, curved, thin lips, thick lips,

Question.AUni: (4) What do people do with their mouth?
(4) Watu hufanyia nini na mdomo?

ExampleWords.AUni: breathe, talk, eat, taste, clear your throat, suck, blow, kiss, gag,
kukohoa, kupiga kwikwi, kucheua, kupiga miayo, kulamba, kubusu

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to moving the mouth?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kuenenda kwa mdomo?

ExampleWords.AUni: open, close, smile, purse your lips,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to yawning?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupiga miayo?
(7) What words refer to vomiting?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kutapika?

ExampleWords.AUni: vomit (v), vomit (n), regurgitate, disgorge, heave, retch, throw up,

Question.AUni: (8) What do people do with their tongue?
(8) Watu hufanyia nini na ulimi wao?

ExampleWords.AUni: lick, lick your lips, stick your tongue out, click your tongue, bite your tongue,

Question.AUni: (9) What do people do to their mouth?
(9) Watu hufanyia nini na mdomo wao?
(10) What words describe something to do with the mouth?
(10) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachohusiana na mdomo?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the teeth.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na meno.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a tooth?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja jino?

ExampleWords.AUni: tooth, incisor, canine tooth, molar, wisdom tooth, milk tooth, baby tooth,

Question.AUni: (2) What are the parts of a tooth?
(2) Sehemu za jino zinaitwaje?
(3) What words describe a person's teeth?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the female reproductive organs and a woman's monthly menstrual cycle. Some of these terms may be taboo. Care must be exercised in which terms are included in the dictionary. A group of women should decide which terms are 'public' and can go in the dictionary, and which would be considered taboo, overly crude, or embarrassing. For example some societies have been afraid that their women will be taken advantage of if these terms are known.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na viungo vya uzazi vya kike na hedhi. Kwa vile maneno fulani ni mwiko au marufuku, chagua kwa umakini maneno yapi yaingizwe kwenye kamusi. Bora kundi la wanawake wayajadiliane na kuyachagua wasije kuchekewa au kuathiriwa vibaya baadaye.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the female organs?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja viungo vya uzazi vya kike?

ExampleWords.AUni: breast, nipple, vagina, clitoris, uterus, womb, ovary, egg, vulva, labia majora, labia minora, vestibule, genitals, private parts,
titi, chuchu, tumbo la uzazi, mji wa mimba, kuma, mirija ya ova, kinembe, kisimi

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a woman's monthly menstrual cycle?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja hedhi?

(3) Maneno gani hutaja wakati wa hedhi?

ExampleWords.AUni: menstruate, period, having (your) period, time of month, menstruation,
kuwa na hedhi, kuingia mwezini, kuvunja ungo

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the discharge?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja utoaji?
(5) What materials are used by women to absorb the discharge?
(5) Vifaa gani hutumika kwa wanawake wakati wa hedhi?

ExampleWords.AUni: sanitary towel, sanitary napkin, tampon, pad, menstrual cloth,

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe something to do with the female organs?

(7) What words refer to the time in a woman's life when she stops menstruating?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja wakati wa maisha ya mwanamke anaposimama kabisa kuwa na hedhi?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words related to all the senses--sight, hearing, smell, taste, and feeling. Some languages may not distinguish some of these senses, and some languages may have words for other senses. There are also other senses that animals have. If your language has words for other senses, include them here.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na milango ya fahamu yote kwa jumla--

ExampleWords.AUni: transparent, clear, see-through, glassy, clear as crystal, crystal clear, show through, unclouded, crystalline, sheer, limpid, vitreous
kung'amuka, kupenyeza nuru, ya kupenya nuru, kuwa angavu

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that light shines through but you can't see through clearly?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho nuru hupenya ndani yake, lakini mtu hawezi kuking'amua kabisa?

ExampleWords.AUni: translucent, frosted, cloudy, clouded, hazy, dim, unclear, vague, foggy, smoky, indistinct, faint, misty, muddy, shadowy, turbid,
yenye kupenyeka nuru, kisicho dhahiri, yenye ukungu, kufifilika, kisichoonekana vizuri, kisicho wazi

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that cannot be seen through?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kisichong'amuka hata kidogo?

ExampleWords.AUni: kisichopitisha nuru, kisichopenyeka nuru, cha giza

(7) Kitu gani kinamsababisha mtu awepo katika hali ya fahamu usio wa kawaida (yaani kuwa na maono au njozi)?

ExampleWords.AUni: be possessed by a spirit, drugs

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that express the idea that something (said, written, thought, or made) depicts or is about a subject, or that something is logically related to some topic. Also use this domain for words that mark the topic or subject of what is being thought about, talked about, or written about. Verbs of thinking, knowing, or speaking (including other types of expression) can take a 'topic' role. We can think of a 'topic' as the main idea. Use this domain also for the important thing in a picture.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno ambayo yanaelezea wazo kwamba jambo fulani (limesemwa, kuandikwa, kufikiriwa, au kutengenezwa) linaonyesha au linahusu mada fulani, au jambo ambalo kwa mantiki linahusiana na mada fulani. Pia tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoonyesha mada au somo ambalo limekuwa likifikiriwa, likizungumzwa, au limekuwa likiandikwa. Vitendo vya kufikiri, kujua, au kuzungumza (kujumuisha aina nyingine za maelekezo) ambayo yanaweza kuchukua wajibu wa mada. Tunaweza kufikiri mada kama ndio wazo kuu. Tumia eneo la maana hili pia kwa vitu muhimu katika picha fulani.

AStr.Run: The book <is about> the President.; The meeting <is about> the schedule.; The story <depicts> the life of the President.; The story <presents> a view of the President.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for obscene words related to sex, defecation, death, damnation, and other taboo or offensive subjects. It is important to check the appropriateness of including obscene words in the dictionary. It should be the choice of the speakers of the language whether a word should be included or excluded. Obscene words included in the dictionary should be clearly marked as such. Obscenity is often used to heighten the emotion of an expression, and is often used when someone is angry. Obscenity is often associated with sex or defecation. Cursing is often associated with God, religion, or the afterlife. Insults often involve equating a person with an animal that is associated with an undesirable characteristic, questioning someone's parentage/legitimacy, questioning someone's character, or questioning someone's intelligence/sanity.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno machafu yanayohusikiana kujamiiana, kunya, kifo, ulaanifu, na miiko mingine. Ni muhimu kupima usahihi wa kuweka maneno machafu katika kamusi. Iwe chaguo la wasemaji wa lugha kama neno fulani iwekwe katika kamusi. Maneno machafu yanayowekwa katika kamusi yawe na alama wazi kuonyesha kwamba maneno hayo ni machafu. Maneno machafu yanatumika mara kwa mara kuzidi hisia ya usemi fulani.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to speech that is considered offensive or improper?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kauli au hotuba ambayo inafikiriwa yenye matusi au kutokufaa?

ExampleWords.AUni: bad language, strong language, swear word, four letter word, curse, obscenities, profanity, swearing, unprintable,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to using obscenity?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kutumia lugha chafu au maneno machafu?
(3) What words are used in an obscene way?
(3) Maneno gani hutumika katika njia chafu?

ExampleWords.AUni: damn, damn it, God damn, Hell, shit, screw, fuck, bastard, son of a bitch, bitch,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe speech or actions that are obscene?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea hotuba au matendo ambayo ni machafu au yenye upungufu?

ExampleWords.AUni: obscene, coarse, crude, dirty, filthy, improper, indecent, lewd, naughty, profane, risque, rude, saucy, suggestive, vulgar,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe someone who uses obscenities a lot?
(5) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu ambaye anatumia maneno mengi yenye uchafu?

ishara ya mkono, kupunga mkono, kufanya ishara, kuashiria

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the expression of good feelings, including laughing--the sounds a person makes when he is enjoying himself or thinks something is funny.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to showing or indicating something--if something (such as an object, something said, or something that happens) shows something, it makes people think of something or understand something (e.g. When his face turns red, it indicates he is angry.)

ExampleWords.AUni: sign, indication, indicator, evidence, mark, trace, manifestation, symptom, omen, telltale, be a giveaway,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to deserving something--if you do something, either good or bad, something can happen to you as a result of what you did. For instance you can receive a reward for doing good, or a punishment for doing wrong. If what happened to you is like what you did, people can think it is right that this thing happened to you.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kustahili kitu--yaani, ukifanya jambo fulani, ama ni zuri au baya, jambo lingine linaweza likakutokea kwa sababu ya jambo la kwanza ulilofanya. Kwa mfano, unaweza kupewa zawadi kwa ajili ya matendo mema, au adhabu kwa ajili ya matendo mabaya. Kama tendo linalofanyika kwako linalingana na tendo ulilolifanya wewe mwenyewe, watu wanaweza kufikiri ni vizuri (yenye haki) kwamba jambo lile limekufanyia.

ExampleWords.AUni: deserve, merit, be owed, be yours by right, have earned,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that someone deserves?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea kitu fulani ambacho mtu anakistahili?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to God--the supreme being in the universe. Each theological system will have different beliefs concerning the existence and nature of God. Our purpose here is to collect and define the terms used to refer to the supreme deity. If there is no such person in the theological system, then use this domain for other terms for the pantheon of gods, ultimate reality, nirvana, and similar concepts. However most theological systems, even atheism, have the concept of a supreme God and use words to refer to him.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na Mungu, yaani yule mwenye enzi kuu katika ulimwengu. Kila mfumo wa theolojia utakuwa na imani tofauti kuhusiana na uwepo na asili ya Mungu. Kusudi letu hapa ni kukusanya maneno yaliyotumika kutaja Mwenyezi Mungu. Ikiwa hakuna mfano wa aina hiyo katika mfumo wa theolojia, kisha tumia eneo hili kwa maneno mengine yanayohusiana na jamii ya miungu yote, uhakika wa mwisho, raha baada ya kufa (kwa dini ya Buddha) na mawazo yanayofanana. Walakini mifumo ya theolojia mingi, hata wale wasioamini kwamba Mungu yupo, wanalo wazo la Mungu mwenye enzi kuu na hutumia maneno kumtaja.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the supreme being in the universe?
(1) Maneno gani humtaja Mwenyezi Mungu wa ulimwengu?

ExampleWords.AUni: God, the Lord, Yahweh, Elohim, Allah, Theos, Deus, Sky God, supreme being, supreme deity

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to what people believe about God?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja jinsi watu wanavyoamini kuhusu Mungu?

ExampleWords.AUni: theolojia, elimu ya tabia na sifa za Mungu na dini, imani ya kuamini Mungu mmoja, imani ya kuamini miungu wengi, imani ya kusadiki kwamba ulimwengu wote ni Mungu, kutoamini Mungu

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something to do with God?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea jambo linalohusiana na Mungu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to supernatural beings--gods, spirits, other types of beings, which normally cannot be seen and do not belong to this world. Some people accept the existence of certain supernatural beings and not others. Mythological beings are those that were believed in during previous times but that are no longer believed in. Fictional beings are those that no one has ever believed in. An indication of whether most people believe in the supernatural being should be put in the definition.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na viumbe vya kiroho, yaani miungu, aina za roho, mapepo, na aina nyingine za viumbe ambavyo kwa kawaida havionekani na ambavyo si vya ulimwengu huu. Baadhi ya watu wanakubali kuwepo kwa viumbe fulani vya kiroho na sio vinginevyo. Pia kuna viumbe vya kiroho wanaosimuliwa katika hadithi, hao waliokuwa wakiaminiwa katika nyakati zilizopita na ambavyo sasa hawaaminiwi tena. Viumbe vya uwongo husimuliwa katika hadithi ambavyo hakuna mtu anayeviamini. Maelekezo kama watu wengi wanaamini kiumbe husika cha kiroho yanatakiwa kuwekwa katika tafsiri. Kwa maneno yanayotaja kiumbe cha enzi kuu cha kiroho tumia neno 4.9.1 'Mungu'.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to supernatural beings?
(1) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja viumbe vya kiroho, kwa jumla?
(2) What words refer to lesser gods?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja miungu midogo au ya chini, yaani siyo Mwenyezi Mungu?

ExampleWords.AUni: god, goddess, the gods, pantheon, deity,

Question.AUni: (3) What types of good supernatural beings are there?
(3) Kuna aina gani za viumbe vizuri vya kiroho?

ExampleWords.AUni: angel, angelic being, cherub, seraph, saint

Question.AUni: (4) What types of evil supernatural beings are there?
(4) Kuna aina gani za viumbe vibaya vya kiroho?

ExampleWords.AUni: demon, devil, Satan, the Devil, Beelzebub

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the spirit of a dead person?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja roho ya mfu?

ExampleWords.AUni: spirit, ghost, specter, apparition, phantom, shade, ghoul

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to supernatural beings that are considered to be mythological or fictional and not real?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja viumbe vya kiroho ambavyo vinahesabiwa kuwa ni hadithi za zamani au vya uongo na sio vya kweli?

ExampleWords.AUni: Santa Claus, elf, fairy, giant, dwarf, sprite, genie, dragon, monster, Cyclops, vampire, alien
Baba wa Krismasi, jitu, dubwana, pepo bawa

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to demon possession--when a demon or spirit influences or controls the behavior of a person. Use this domain for all words related to the relationship between spirits and people, including communication between people and spirits. Also use this domain for words referring to casting out demons--causing a demon to stop influencing or controlling a person.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja hali ya kupagawa na pepo mchafu--yaani wakati pepo au roho anapovuta au kutawala mwenendo wa mtu. Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na uhusiano kati ya watu na mapepo, usisahau mawasiliano kati ya watu na mapepo. Pia tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kutoa mapepo--yaani, kusababisha pepo liache kumwongoza au kumdhibiti mtu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being influenced or controlled by a demon?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuathiriwa au kuongozwa na pepo mchafu?

ExampleWords.AUni: be possessed, be demonized, go into a trance,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to what demons do to people?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja mambo mapepo wanayoyafanyia watu?

ExampleWords.AUni: possess, inhabit, demonize, torture, haunt, trouble
kupagawa, kukalia, kuingiza pepo, kuumiza, kufanya makao, kusumbua

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to casting out a demon?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumtoa au kumpunga pepo mchafu?

ExampleWords.AUni: cast out a demon, exorcise, drive out, expel, deliver/free/release from demonic power/influence

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a person who casts out demons?
(4) Maneno gani humtaja mtu ambaye hutoa au hupunga mapepo?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the primary goal or goals of a religion, for instance in Christianity salvation from sin, death and Hell. Each religion has different beliefs about salvation. Our purpose here is not to preach or argue, but to list those words that people use to talk about this topic.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na lengo au kusudi kuu la dini fulani, kwa mfano katika Ukristo wokovu kutoka katika dhambi, mauti na jehanamu. Kila dini ina imani tofauti kuhusu wokovu. Kusudi letu hapa sio kuhubiri, bali kupata maneno ambayo watu hutumia kuongelea jambo hili.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to religious practitioners--people who practice a religion, who are members of the religion, believe in the religion, leaders of the religion, and followers of the religion. Each religion has its own terms for religious practitioners. List these terms separately for each religion. The examples given below are for the Christian religion.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja wanasheria wa dini--yaani watu ambao hufanya ibada ya dini, ambao ni washirika wa dini, waaminio katika dini, viongozi wa dini, na wafuasi wa dini. Kila dini ina maneno yake kwa wanasheria wa dini. Orodhesha maneno hayo kwa kila dini. Mifano iliyotolewa chini ni kwa ajili ya dini ya Kikristo.

Question.AUni: (1) What is a person called who believes in a religion?
(1) Aaminaye katika dini fulani anaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: believer, member (of the faith), adherent, follower, practitioner

(2) Aaminaye katika dini ya (Kikristo) anaitwaje?

(3) Kiongozi wa dini ya (Kikristo-Kiprotestani) anaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: priest, father, bishop, archbishop, Cardinal, pope, man of the cloth

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to prepared food. Cultures vary widely in the number and types of foods they prepare, and in how they classify them. For instance the English distinction between main dish and side dish is not found in the classification system of other languages. If your language has well-recognized subcategories, you can set up a separate subdomain for each. The questions below are based on the main ingredient in the dish.

Tumia eneo la maana hili ili kupata maneno yanayotaja chakula kilichokwisha kupikwa. Tamaduni zinatofautiana katika idadi na aina za vyakula na pia katika namna ya kuviainisha vyakula. Kwa mfano, katika Kiingereza kuna tofauti kati ya chakula kuu na vyakula vingine vidogo vidogo, lakini tofauti hii haipo katika lugha nyingine. Kama lugha yenu inaziainisha vyakula kwa namna inavyofahamika vizuri, mnaweza kutengeneza maeneo mapya ya maana. Maswali hapo chini yanalingana na kiambato kikuu katika chakula fulani.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to prepared food?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja chakula kilichokwisha kupikwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: cooked food, prepared food, dish, course

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a major class of prepared food?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja aina za vyakula vikuu vilivyokwisha kupikwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: main dish, side dish, meat dish, casserole, vegetable, staple, bread, soup, salad, fruit, condiment, dessert, candy, cookie, sweets, savories, snack
chakula kikuu, nyama, mboga, matunda, supu, mkate, kachumbari, kinyunya

Question.AUni: (3) What general words refer to a food made primarily from meat?
(3) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja chakula kinachotokana hasa na nyama kwa jumla?

ExampleWords.AUni: meat dish, main dish, main course

Question.AUni: (4) What types of foods are made primarily from meat?
(4) Aina gani za vyakula hutokana hasa na nyama?

ExampleWords.AUni: roast beef, steak, fried chicken, fish and chips, hamburger, hotdog, pizza, spaghetti, casserole, lasagna, stew
nyama ya ng'ombe, nyama choma, nyama ya kuku, samaki, sambusa, steki la ng'ombe, soseji, kuku iliyobanikwa

Question.AUni: (5) What foods are made primarily from staple foods?
(5) Vyakula gani hutokana hasa na vyakula vikuu?

ExampleWords.AUni: mashed potatoes and gravy, pasta, cooked rice, stuffing, oatmeal, porridge, cereal, mush
ugali, mtori, ftari, viazi, wali, ubwabwa, tambi, uji

Question.AUni: (6) What types of bread are there?
(6) Aina za mikate huitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: bread, pastry, brown bread, white bread, biscuit, muffin, roll, sweetbread, sandwich, tortilla, toast, loaf

Question.AUni: (7) What foods are made primarily from fruit?
(7) Vyakula gani hutokana hasa na matunda?

ExampleWords.AUni: ndizi iliyobanikwa na asali, saladi ya matunda

Question.AUni: (8) What foods are made primarily from vegetables?
(8) Vyakula gani hutokana hasa na mboga?

ExampleWords.AUni: side dish, vegetable, carrot sticks, onion rings

Question.AUni: (9) What foods are made primarily from leaves and stems?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to special clothes worn on special occasions. It is necessary to think through all the various special occasions in the culture and think of any special clothes worn on those occasions. Two examples are given below for work and graduation, but there are many others.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na nguo au mavazi maalum kwa ajili ya shughuli maalum. Ni muhimu kufikiria mavazo ambayo hutumika maalum katika mila na desturi ya jamii hiyo, k.m. kwa ajili ya sherehe, kwa ajili ya kazi, na kadhalika. Mifano miwili (kwa kazi na kwa mahafali) imetolewa hapo chini, lakini mifano mingine mingi inawezekana.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to clothes worn on a special occasion?
(1) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja mavazi yanayotumika kwa ajili ya shughuli maalum kwa jumla?

ExampleWords.AUni: sports clothes, work clothes, formal clothes, informal, office wear
nguo za michezo, nguo za kazi

Question.AUni: (2) What special clothes are worn for work?
(2) Aina gani ya mavazi huvaliwa kwa ajili ya kazi?

ExampleWords.AUni: work clothes, overalls, coveralls, apron, work gloves, hardhat, steel-toed shoes, boots, goggles

Question.AUni: (3) What special clothes are worn for graduation?
(3) Aina gani ya mavazi huvaliwa wakati wa mahafali?

Name.AUni: Nguo kwa ajili ya watu maalumu

AStr.Run: Use this domain for special clothes worn by special people. It is necessary to think through all the various special types of people in the culture and think of any special clothes worn by them. Several examples are given below, but there are many others.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoonyesha au kuelezea mavazi kwa ajili ya watu maalumu. Ni muhimu kufikiria watu maalumu katika maeneo mbalimbali katika mila ya jamii hiyo. Mifano mbalimbali imetolewa hapo chini, lakini mifano mingine mingi inawezekana.

(1) Aina gani ya mavazi maalumu huvaliwa na polisi au wanajeshi?

ExampleWords.AUni: police uniform, military uniform, nurse's uniform, band uniform

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being naked--not wearing any clothes, and for words referring to how a person feels about being naked. It is a part of universal human experience that people do not want to be naked. So there are words that refer to feeling bad if one does not have enough clothes on (shame). Other words refer to wanting to have enough clothes (modest). Other words refer to how people feel about other people who do not wear enough clothes (indecent).
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kuwa uchi--yaani kutokuvaa nguo yoyote. Pia taja maneno yanayotaja jinsi mtu anavyojisikia anapokuwa uchi.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being naked?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kuwa uchi au kutokuvaa nguo?

ExampleWords.AUni: be naked, nakedness, nude, nudity, unclothed, nothing on, not have anything on, stripped, bare, expose (oneself)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words that refer to fire and for words referring to types of fire. These words may be specific for what is being burned (forest fire 'a fire burning a forest'), the size of the fire (inferno 'a very large hot fire'), or the place where the fire burns (hellfire 'the fire in hell').

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja moto na aina mbalimbali za moto. Maneno hayo yanaweza kuwa maalumu kulingana na kitu kinachoungua (k.m., moto wa kiberiti), ukubwa au kipimo cha moto, au mahali penye moto.

(3) Maneno gani hutaja kilichoungua?

ExampleWords.AUni: house fire, forest fire, grass fire, wood fire, oil fire

(4) Maneno gani hutaja ukubwa au kipimo cha moto?

ExampleWords.AUni: spark, flame, flicker, finger, tongue, flare, blaze, conflagration, inferno, raging inferno

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to harvesting crops. If there is an important crop and there are a lot of words that refer to harvesting it, set up a special domain for it, such as 'Harvest rice' or 'Harvest coconuts'. If there is more than one such crop, set up a separate domain for each of them.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kuvuna mavuno. Kama kuna mavuno maalumu na kuna maneno mengi yanayotaja tendo la kuyavuna, anzisha eneo la maana maalumu kwa ajili yake, k.m. 'Kuvuna mpunga' au 'Kuvuna nazi'. Kama kuna mavuno zaidi kama hiyo moja, anzisha eneo moja kwa kila aina ya mavuno (tumia namba 6.2.5.6, 6.2.5.7 n.k.).

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to harvesting?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuvuna?

ExampleWords.AUni: harvest, reap, gather in the harvest

ExampleWords.AUni: harvest maize, harvest rice, harvest yams, harvest beans, pick fruit, pluck an apple, dig potatoes, pull carrots, cut vegetables

ExampleWords.AUni: lie fallow, animals graze, plow under plants

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words indicating the posture or stance of a person's body. Use the domains in this section for specific words for postures and for moving parts of the body. Many of these words have two meanings. One meaning is stative, indicating that the body is in a particular posture, but not moving. The other meaning is active, indicating that the person is moving his body into a particular posture. Some of these words can be used of animals or even things, if the things are perceived as being similar in posture to that of a human body.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno ya kawaida yanayoonyesha mkao au hali ya kusimama kwa mwili wa mtu kwa jumla. Tumia maeneo ya maana mengine yanayohusiana na eneo hili kwa maneno maalumu kwa mkao na viungo-tendaji katika mwili (k.m., mtikisiko wa mwili mzima, n.k.). Mengi ya maneno haya yana maana mbili.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a person's posture?
(1) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja mikao fulani ya mtu kwa jumla?

ExampleWords.AUni: mkao, msimamo, nafasi ya msimamo, hali ya msimamo

Question.AUni: (2) What general words refer to changing your posture?
(2) Maneno gani ya kawaida yanataja hali ya kubadili mkao kwa jumla?

ExampleWords.AUni: change your posture/stance, pose, shift, squirm

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to standing. The words in this domain may include whether the person is standing on one foot or two, whether the person's feet are together or placed apart, whether something is between the person's feet, how fast the person stands up.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kusimama. Maneno katika eneo la maana hili yanaweza kurejea hali ya mtu kuwa amesimama kwa mguu mmoja au yote miwili, ameikusanya miguu yake pamoja au ameiachanisha, kama kuna kitu katikati ya miguu yake na namna mtu anavyoinuka kusimama kwa haraka.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being in a standing position?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kuwa katika hali ya kusimama?

ExampleWords.AUni: stand, be standing, be on your feet

(2) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuinuka na kusimama kutoka katika hali ya kukaa?

ExampleWords.AUni: stand, stand up, rise (to your feet), get up, get to your feet, jump to your feet, leap up, leap out of the chair, pick yourself up

Question.AUni: (3) How do people stand?

ExampleWords.AUni: stand on one leg, straddle, stand on tiptoes

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to bowing to someone--to face someone and lower your head or bend at the waist so that your upper body is lowered. The words in this domain should all be symbolic acts, that is, the culture assigns a meaning and significance to the physical action. Some cultures define it as a greeting, as an act of respect, or as an act of submission. For instance in ancient middle eastern culture bowing was an act of submission done in the presence of the king. Failure to bow was an act of rebellion punishable by death. In far eastern culture it is a greeting. In African culture it is an act of respect or done to welcome a visitor. Cultures define how a person is to bow, for instance how they are to hold their hands. A person may bow while standing, or may kneel, or even prostrate himself flat on his face. Whether both people bow is also significant. The depth of the bow can have significance. In Japan the person of lower social rank must bow deeper. In European culture a performer bows to acknowledge applause.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kuinama--yaani kuninginiza kichwa chini, kupinda kiunoni, au mwinamo wa mwili mzima.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to bowing?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kujishusha au kuinama kwa heshima?

ExampleWords.AUni: bow, bow down, bow to/before someone
kunyenyekea kwa heshima, kujiinamisha chini, kujishusha

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe how a person bows?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea jinsi mtu anavyoinama?

ExampleWords.AUni: sweeping bow, bow low, deep bow, slight bow, bow your head, his head fell, incline your head, nod, curtsy, genuflect, kowtow, prostrate, grovel
kuinama kwa kupepesuka sujudu, kujipinda, mwinamo wa heshima

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate the significance of the bow?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha umuhimu wa kuinama kwa heshima?

ExampleWords.AUni: kustahi, kuabudu, kusujudu, kuinama kutoa salamu ya heshima
