AStr.Run: Use this domain for intransitive verbs of movement referring to moving your whole body to a different location. There are many components of meaning involved in verbs of movement. They can include a source location (from), a goal location (to), a path (along), manner (walk, run), speed (race, crawl), direction (forward, back, side, up, down, toward, away from), shape of the path (straight, curve, circle, angle), relationship to some object or objects (on, hang, against, between, across, through, into, out of, onto, off of, around), proximity (near, far), multiple movements (back and forth, return, bounce), inclusion with other objects or parts of objects (join, leave, collect, disperse, unite, separate), volition (go versus drift), intransitive versus transitive (move versus move something). Some verbs of movement do not involve moving from one place to another, but express bodily movement.
Tumia eneo hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kusogeza mwili mzima kwenda eneo lingine.

ExampleWords.AUni: move, movement, change position, maneuver, jockey for position, budge

ExampleWords.AUni: slow down, slow up, decelerate, coast to a stop, (its) speed fell, ease off, reduce your speed, decrease your speed, come to a stop

Question.AUni: (3) What do you say to someone when you want him to slow down?
(3) Unasemaje ukitaka mtu apunguze mwendo?

ExampleWords.AUni: Slow down! Whoa! (horse) Wait, wait! Wait for me! Wait a minute! Can we slow down?

Question.AUni: (4) What idiophones are used of moving slowly?
(4) Maneno gani hutumika kama sauti ya tendo la kwenda polepole inafanana na neno lenyewe?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to wandering--to move slowly without any purpose or goal.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kuzurura--yaani kutembea polepole bila kusudi wala lengo au shabaha ya unakokwenda.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to wandering?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuzurura?

ExampleWords.AUni: wander, meander, ramble, roam, prowl, walk around

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person who wanders?
(2) Maneno gani humtaja mtu anayezurura?

ExampleWords.AUni: mzururaji, mhuni, kuzengea bila mpango, hana mbele wala nyuma

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a graceful manner.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja kwenda kwa kudundika.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe someone who moves in a graceful way?
(1) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu anayeenda kwa kudundika?

ExampleWords.AUni: graceful, coordinated, elegant, light-footed, light on your feet, lithe,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe graceful movements?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea mwendo wa kudundika?

ExampleWords.AUni: graceful, elegant, smooth, flowing, effortless, easy, with ease,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer graceful movement?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja mwendo wa kudundika?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a clumsy manner.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda kwa maringo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe someone who moves in a clumsy way?
(1) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu anayeenda au kusogea kwa maringo?

ExampleWords.AUni: uncoordinated, awkward, ungainly, clumsy, gawky, inelegant, klutz, ungraceful, lumbering, have two left feet, gangling,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe someone who is clumsy and often has accidents?
(2) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu ambaye hatembei vizuri na anajiumia mara kwa mara?

ExampleWords.AUni: clumsy, klutz, be all thumbs, accident-prone, ham-fisted, bungling, bumbling, bull in a china shop, butterfingers,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to walking with some difficulty such as stumbling--to miss your step because of hitting an object such as a stone, hole, or mud; staggering--to walk unsteadily because of weakness, illness, or drunkenness; or limping--to walk unevenly or with difficulty because of injury to a foot.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na pale mtu anapotembea na kujikwaruza--yaani kutotembea vizuri kwa sababu ya kukanyaga jiwe, kisiki, shimo, au matope. Pia andika maneno yanayotaja tendo la kutotembea vizuri kwa sababu ya magonjwa, ulevi au jeraha mguuni.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to stumbling?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kujikwaa?

ExampleWords.AUni: stumble, trip, trip and fall, slip

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to causing someone to stumble?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusababisha mtu kukwaa?
(3) What words refer to staggering?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupepesuka au kuyumbayumba?

ExampleWords.AUni: stagger, weave back and forth, reel, lurch

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to limping?
(4) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu anayechechemea?

ExampleWords.AUni: limp, hobble, shamble, shuffle, walk haltingly, walk with a cane, use crutches, get around

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe someone who cannot walk well?
(5) Maneno gani humtaja mtu ambaye hawezi kutembea vizuri?
(6) What things do people use to help them walk?
(6) Watu hutumia vitu gani ili kuwasaidia kutembea?

ExampleWords.AUni: walker, cane, crutch, walking stick, wheelchair

AStr.Run: Use this domain for moving across a smooth or lubricated surface.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kuvuka mahali laini, ambapo huteleza.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving across a smooth or lubricated surface?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupita sehemu laini na kuteleza?

ExampleWords.AUni: slip, slide, glide, coast, skim, skate

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe a surface that something can easily slip on?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea sehemu ambayo kitu fulani kinaweza kuteleza kwa urahisi juu yake?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to balancing yourself or something--when someone or something is able stand or move without falling.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja jinsi ilivyo rahisi kwa mtu au kitu kuondolewa au kusogezwa.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that can move?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachoweza kwenda au kusogea?

ExampleWords.AUni: movable, mobile, mobility, portable, loose, fluid, free,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that cannot move?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kisichoweza kwenda au kusogea?

ExampleWords.AUni: fixed, immovable, stuck, jammed, stiff, won't budge, can't budge something, can't move, immobile, paralyzed, stranded, entangled, caught, bound, permanent, rooted, entrenched, established, settled, set,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is easy to move?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho ni rahisi kukisogeza?

ExampleWords.AUni: unsteady, shaky, easily moved, unstable, unsettled, rickety, tottering, wobbly

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something that is difficult to move?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho ni vigumu kukisogeza?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to balancing yourself or something--when someone or something is able stand or move without falling.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kujisawazisha au kusawazisha kitu kingine--yaani kitu au mtu anapoweza kusimama au kwenda bila kuanguka chini.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to balancing yourself?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kujisawazisha (ili usianguke)?
(2) What words refer to balancing something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusawazisha kitu kingine (ili kisianguke)?
(3) What words refer to the ability to balance yourself?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja uwezo wa kujisawazisha?
(4) What words refer to losing your balance?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kukosa usawa?
(5) What words describe something that is balanced?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho ni sawa (yaani hakiwezi kuanguka)?
(6) What words describe something that is not balanced?
(6) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho si sawa (yaani kinaweza kuanguka)?
(7) What words refer to feeling like you are going to fall?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuhisi kwamba utaanguka?

ExampleWords.AUni: dizzy, giddy, vertigo, dizziness, someone's head is swimming,

Name.AUni: Kwenda au kusogea kwa kupiga kelele

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to making a noise while moving.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kupiga kelele wakati unapotembea au kusogea.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to making a noise while moving?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja sauti zinazotolewa wakati unatembea au kusogea?

ExampleWords.AUni: bang, buzz, chug, clack, clang, clank, clatter, click, clink, clump, clunk, crackle, crash, creak, crunch, fizz, gurgle, hiss, howl, patter, ping, purr, putter, roar, rumble, rustle, screech, splash, splutter, squelch, swish, thud, thump, thunder, wheeze, whine, whir, zing

AStr.Run: Use the domains in this section for words referring to moving in a direction related to the orientation of the person's body (not in relation to the position of the destination).
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda kwa mwelekeo mmoja ukilinganisha na mkao wa mwili wa mtu.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to moving in a direction?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda kwa mwelekeo mmoja?

ExampleWords.AUni: head (in a direction), go (in a direction)

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the direction in which a person is moving?
(2) Maneno gani yanataja mwelekeo wa mwendo wa mtu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a forward direction--in the same direction the person is facing.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda mbele--yaani kwenda kwa mwelekeo ambao mtu anakabili.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving forward?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea tendo la kwenda mbele?

ExampleWords.AUni: move forward, advance, move ahead, go ahead

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a backward direction--the person is facing one direction, but moving toward their back--to move in the opposite direction from the direction the person is facing.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda nyuma--yaani mtu anakabili mwelekeo mmoja, lakini anaenda kinyume.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving backwards while still facing forward?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda nyuma wakati mtu anakabili mbele?

ExampleWords.AUni: move back, back up, move backwards, move in reverse

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a sideways direction--the person is facing one direction, but moving toward their side.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda upande--yaani mtu anakabili mwelekeo mmoja, lakini anaenda au anasogea kwa upande wake.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving sideways?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda kwa upande?

ExampleWords.AUni: move sideways, make room for, move aside, move out of the way, get out of the way, move over, budge, shift
kwenda kwa upande, kwenda upandeupande, kwenda upande, kuacha nafasi, kwenda pembeni, kutoka njiani

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in an upward direction or to moving to a higher place.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda juu au kwenye mahali pa juu zaidi.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving up?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kwenda juu?

ExampleWords.AUni: move up, go up, arise, hop up, lift yourself up, pull yourself up, jump, surge, go higher, get higher, levitate,
kwenda juu, kwenda juu kiwimawima, kupandisha, kuinua, kupanda, kupaa

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to moving up through the air?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda juu hewani?
(3) What words refer to moving up into the air quickly?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda juu hewani kwa haraka?
(4) What words refer to climbing?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupanda kitu (k.m., mlima)?

ExampleWords.AUni: climb, scale, clamber, shin up, shinny up,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to moving onto something?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupanda ndani ya kitu (k.m., gari)?

ExampleWords.AUni: climb onto, get on, mount, embark, hop onto, jump onto,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to climbing over something?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupanda juu ya kitu (na kufika upande mwingine)?
(7) What words refer to the sun or moon moving up in the sky?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kutembea kwa jua au mwezi angani?
(8) What words refer to an airplane moving up?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja ndege inapopanda juu?

ExampleWords.AUni: leave the ground, take off, lift off, blast-off, launch,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to the act of moving up?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda juu?
(10) What words refer to someone who moves up?
(10) Maneno gani humtaja mtu anayeenda juu?
(11) What words refer to the sport of climbing?
(11) Maneno gani hutaja mchezo wa kupanda milima?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving in a downward direction or to moving to a lower place.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda chini au kwenye mahali pa chini zaidi.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving down slowly or purposefully?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda chini polepole au kwa kusudi?

ExampleWords.AUni: move down, go down, lower oneself, climb down, jump down, descend, descent

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something falling--for something to move down under the influence of gravity.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kitu kuanguka--yaani kitu kwenda chini kwa sababu ya uvutano wa dunia.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to falling?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kuanguka?
(2) What words refer to accidentally falling from a high position?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka kutoka mahali pa juu bila kusudi?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall off, take a fall, tumble, be thrown,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to falling from a very high position?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka kutoka mahali pa juu sana?
(4) What words refer to falling from a standing position?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka kutoka mkao wa kusimama?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall down, fall over, have a fall, fall flat on your face, collapse, topple over, keel over, go head over heels, fall headlong,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to almost falling?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kukaribia kuanguka?

ExampleWords.AUni: trip, slip, stumble, lose your balance, lose your footing, keep your balance, stay up,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to falling off of something?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka kutoka juu ya kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall from, fall out, come off,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the act of falling?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka?
(8) What words refer to slowly falling?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka polepole?

ExampleWords.AUni: sink slowly, float down, drift down, settle,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to something like rain or leaves falling through the air?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kama mvua au majani yanapoanguka au yanapodondoka?
(10) What words refer to letting something fall?
(10) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuacha kitu kianguke?
(11) What words refer to something falling onto its side?
(11) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kuanguka au kudondoka kwenye upande wake?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall over, topple over, tip over,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to a building falling?
(12) Maneno gani hutaja jengo linapoanguka?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall down, collapse, fall in, cave in,

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to causing someone to fall?
(13) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumsababisha mtu aanguke?

ExampleWords.AUni: knock down, push over, trip, knock someone to the ground, bring down,

Question.AUni: (14) What words refer to causing something to fall?
(14) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusababisha kitu kianguke?

ExampleWords.AUni: knock over, upset, tip over, overturn,

Question.AUni: (15) What words refer to water falling?
(15) Maneno gani hutaja maji yanapodondoka?
(16) What words refer to falling into water?
(16) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuanguka katika maji?

ExampleWords.AUni: sink, fall overboard, plunge into, fall into, plop, plunk,

Question.AUni: (17) What words refer to the force that causes things to fall?
(17) Maneno gani hutaja mvuto unaosababisha vitu kuanguka?
(18) What words refer to keeping something from falling?
(18) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuzuia kitu kisianguke?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to turning and changing the direction in which one is moving.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kugeuka au kubadilisha mwelekeo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to turning?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kugeuka?

ExampleWords.AUni: turn, change direction/course, deviate, go off at an angle, swerve,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to turning around and moving in the opposite direction?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kugeuka na kwenda kwa mwelekeo wa kinyume?

ExampleWords.AUni: turn around, reverse direction, retreat, go back, retire to the rear

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to continually changing the direction you are facing in until you are once again facing in the same direction, e.g. moving in a circle, moving around something, or rotating.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kuendelea kubadilisha mwelekeo mpaka unapokabili tena mwelekeo wa awali (yaani kwenda kwa duara, kuzunguka kitu fulani, au kuzunguka kama mhimili wa dunia).

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving around in a circle?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda kwa duara?

ExampleWords.AUni: move in a circle, curve, circulate, turn around, swing, cycle

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to moving around something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuzunguka kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: move around, surround, encircle, revolve, swivel, pivot

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to rotating?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuzunguka kama mhimili wa dunia?

ExampleWords.AUni: rotate, spin, wheel, twirl, whirl, gyrate, roll, gyrate, revolve, swivel

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to rolling something?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuvingirisha kitu juu ya ardhi?

ExampleWords.AUni: kuvingirisha, kuviringisha, kufinginyisha, kubingirisha, kwa magurudumu, kwa magogo, kwa chao

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to moving back and forth.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kusogea mbele na nyuma.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving back and forth?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusogea mbele na nyuma?

ExampleWords.AUni: move back and forth, rock, rock back and forth, wave, swing
kwenda mbele na nyuma, kusogeasogea, kupiga nyuma na mbele

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to something moving back and forth quickly?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kilichosogezwa nyuma na mbele kwa haraka sana?
(3) What words refer to shaking oneself?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kujitikisa?

ExampleWords.AUni: shake, shiver, wiggle, wriggle, squirm, writhe

Name.AUni: Kwenda moja kwa moja bila kugeuka

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving straight without changing direction.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda moja kwa moja bila kubadilisha mwelekeo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving straight?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda moja kwa moja?

ExampleWords.AUni: go straight, in a straight line, direct, as the crow flies

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving toward, in the direction of, or near something or some place. The words in this domain should refer to moving in the direction of a place, but should not require that the person actually arrived. Some languages (such as German and Polish) distinguish 'go on foot' from 'go in a vehicle'.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja mwendo wa kwendea au wa kukaribia kitu au mahali fulani. Maneno katika eneo la maana hili yataje tendo la kuelekea mahali fulani, lakini siyo lazima kwamba mtu ameshafika mahali hapo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving toward a place?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuelekea mahali fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: move toward, go toward, head toward, go in the (general) direction of

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to moving near something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kukaribia kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: approach, move near, come near, move in on

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to two things moving toward each other?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja vitu viwili vinapoelekeana?

ExampleWords.AUni: converge, be on a collision course

AStr.Run: They didn't know it, but their paths were converging.; The two ships were on a collision course.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the place toward which a person is moving?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja mahali mtu anakoelekea?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving away from a place.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kusogea mbali na kitu au mahali.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving away from something?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea tendo la kusogea mbali na kitu au mahali fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: move from/away/away from, go away, get away, retreat, back off, run away, come from
kutoka, kuondoka, kusogea mbali na, kujiepusha, kukwepa, kukaa mbali

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving away from the speaker. In Australian languages many movement words are marked for direction toward or away from the speaker.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kwenda mbali na mtu msemaji.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving away from the speaker?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda mbali na mtu msemaji?

ExampleWords.AUni: go (away), leave here/this place, get out of here
kwenda (sehemu nyingine), kuondoka, kumuacha, kutoka sehemu hiyo

Question.AUni: (2) What do people say when they want someone to go away?
(2) Watu husemaje wanapotaka mtu aende mbali?

AStr.Run: Go away!; Leave me alone!; Get out of my sight!
Use this domain for words referring to moving toward the speaker.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kumwendea mtu msemaji.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving toward the speaker?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumwendea mtu msemaji?
(2) What do people say when they want someone to come?
(2) Watu husemaje wanapotaka mtu aje?

AStr.Run: Come here!; Get over here!
Use this domain for words referring to moving away from a place.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kujiondoa kutoka eneo fulani.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to leaving a place?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuondoka mahali fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: leave, depart, departure, go away, withdraw, take your leave, scram, skedaddle, beat it, set out, hit the road, quit (a place), absent yourself, slip away, vacate, make yourself scarce,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to arriving at a place.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tendo la kuwasili au kufika katika eneo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to arriving at a place?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuwasili au kufika katika eneo?

ExampleWords.AUni: arrive, arrival, reach, get to, come to, attain, land, landing, advent

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to moving into something, such as a house or an area.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kuingia ndani ya kitu, kama vile nyumba au eneo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving into an area or space?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuingia ndani ya eneo fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: move in, go in, go into, enter
kwenda ndani, kuingia, kupeleka ndani, kuwasili

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to moving toward the center of something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kwenda kwa kati ya kitu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to moving out of something, such as a house or area.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kutoka nje ya kitu, kama vile nyumba au eneo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving out of an area or space?
(1) Maneno gani hutajaq tendo la kutoka nje ya kitu au eneo fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: move out, go out, come out, get out, emerge, exit, exodus, issue, leave,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to an opening where something can move out?

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by holding them?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumzuia mtu asiende au kusogea kwa njia ya kumshika?

ExampleWords.AUni: hold, hold down, restrain, pin someone down, seize,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by tying them?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumzuia mtu asiende au kusogea kwa njia ya kumfunga na kamba?

ExampleWords.AUni: handcuff, shackle, tie up, bind, binding,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by putting them in an enclosure?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumzuia mtu asiende kwa njia ya kumfungia ndani ya kachumba kadogo?

ExampleWords.AUni: lock up, cage, confine, contain, corral, shut up, trap

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by getting in their way?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumzuia mtu asiende kwa njia ya kuziba njia yake?

ExampleWords.AUni: block, check, hem in, blockade, get in the way,

Question.AUni: (6) What things are used to prevent someone from moving?
(6) Vitu gani hutumika katika kumzuia mtu asiende?
(7) What words describe someone who is being prevented from moving?
(7) Maneno gani humwelezea mtu ambaye anazuiliwa asiende?

ExampleWords.AUni: be under restraint, bound, captive, in confinement, held, limited, restricted,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to waiting in a place, waiting to do something, or waiting for something to happen. The basic idea of waiting is for someone to not do anything for a period of time, because he expects something to happen that will cause him to do something.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kusubiri katika mahali fulani, kumsubiri mtu au kusubiria kitu kitokee. Wazo hapa juu ya kusubiri ni kukaa bila kufanya kitu kwa wakati, kwa sababu mtu anayesubiri anatazamia kitu kingetokea ambacho kingemfanyia afanye kitu kingine.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to waiting?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusubiri?

ExampleWords.AUni: wait, wait for, wait up for, wait on, await, hang on, stand by, wait around, hang around, hold off, wait your turn, sit something out, cool your heels, bide your time, sit tight, sweat it out, hesitate, hesitation, wait and see, wait behind, lie in wait, waiting room, waiting list

kusubiri, kusuburia, kungoja, kungojea, kuvumilia, kulimbika, kukalia, wa stahimilivu, mvumilivu, mwenye saburi, kustahimili, kuchukuana na, idili, ulabibu, kutazamia, kuahirisha, kutegemea, kutumaini

Question.AUni: (2) How do you tell someone to wait?
(2) Unasemaje ukitaka mtu akusubiri?

ExampleWords.AUni: Wait! Wait up. Just a minute. Just a moment. I'll be right with you. Hold on. Hang on. Please hold.

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to waiting in a line of people?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusubiri katika safu ya watu?

ExampleWords.AUni: line up, queue, stand in line, cut in line

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe how a person feels when he must wait?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea jinsi mtu anavyojisikia inapombidi asubiri?

ExampleWords.AUni: look forward to, expectant, (I) can't wait, patient, impatient

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to making someone wait?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kumfanya mtu asubiri?

ExampleWords.AUni: keep someone waiting, make someone wait, delay

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to a period of time when you have to wait?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja kipindi ambacho unahitaji kusubiri?
(7) What words refer to refusing to wait patiently and going ahead of other people instead?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kukataa kusubiri kwa uvumilivu na kujitanguliza mbele ya watu wengine?

ExampleWords.AUni: cut in line, cut in front of someone, cut someone off, jump the queue, push in

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to organizing things, people, events, and ideas--to think about and decide on the pattern a group of things should be arranged in, and then doing whatever is necessary to arrange them so that they can be used for some purpose. This domain is like the domain 'Arrange' except that 'Arrange' emphasizes physically moving the things, and the domain 'Organize' emphasizes the logical system. 'Organize' does not require that the things be moved, only that the logical pattern is specified.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kupanga jambo, watu, matokeo, na mawazo--yaani, kufikiria na kuamua ratiba au mpangilio wa kundi la vitu upangwe vipi, na baada ya kuamua ni kufanya kinachohitajika ili kuliweka lile kundi katika hali ya kutumika kwa lengo fulani. Eneo la maana hili ni kama eneo la maana 7.5 'Kupanga' isipokuwa 7.5 'Kupanga' linahusu zaidi kusogeza vitu, na eneo la maana hili 7.5.5 'Kupanga, kurekebisha' linahusu zaidi wazo la kupanga kwa mantiki. Maneno katika eneo la maana hili, 7.5.5 'Kupanga, kurekebisha', hayahitaji kumaanisha kwamba vitu vimesogezwa, yanaweza kumaanisha tu kwamba wazo la kupanga kwa mantiki lipo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to organizing things?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupanga au kurekebisha mambo?

ExampleWords.AUni: organize, dispose, structure, get together, get it together, get your act together, chart, marshal, put in a chart, put in a table, put in a matrix, sort, sort out, systematize, tabulate,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to kicking--to hit something with your foot. The words in this domain may be distinguished by the way in which the foot moves, either in a swinging motion, or by first bending the leg and then quickly straightening it. They may also be distinguished by whether the foot moves horizontally or vertically, whether the effect is to move something or damage it, or how hard the person kicks.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana tendo la kukipiga kitu kwa mguu. Maneno kwenye eneo la maana hili yanaweza kutofautishwa na jinsi mguu unavyoenda, ama ni mwendo wa kubembea, au ni kwanza kukunja mguu kidogo kabla ya kuunyoosha haraka. Pia yanaweza kutofautishwa na kama mguu unapigwa juu au pembeni, kama tokeo linalolengwa ni kuharibu kitu au kukisogeza tu, au nguvu inayotumika wakati wa kupiga.

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a hole dug in the ground?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja shimo lililochimbwa katika ardhi?

ExampleWords.AUni: hole, pit, mine, excavation, tunnel, burrow, trench, ditch, shaft, foxhole, crater, cave, cavern, grotto

Question.AUni: (3) What tools and machines are used to dig?
(3) Zana na mashine gani hutumika kwa kuchimba?

ExampleWords.AUni: shovel, spade, hoe, pickaxe, steam shovel, bulldozer, backhoe

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe the size of a hole in the ground?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea ukubwa au udogo wa shimo lililopo kwenye ardhi?
(5) What words refer to putting something in a hole and covering it up?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuweka kitu fulani shimoni na kulifunika?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to damaging something--to do something bad to something, but not completely ruin it so that it can't be used any more.

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the damage done to something?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja madhara yaliyofanyika kwa kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: damage (n), scar, wear (n), wear and tear,

(7) Maneno gani humtaja mtu anayeharibu vitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: vandal, saboteur, bull in a china shop,

Question.AUni: (12) What words describe something that can be damaged easily?

Use this domain for general words referring to the amount or quantity of something.

ExampleWords.AUni: portion, helping, serving, intake, ration, measure,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a measured amount of something?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to numbers. Every language has a word for 'one', and a word for 'two'. These two numbers often have special words. So we have included a separate domain for 'one' and 'two'. In addition the numbers form a series (one, two, three...). Most languages have more than one series of numbers (first, second, third...). So we have also included a domain for each series of numbers that most languages have. Your language may have other series of numbers. Put them in the domain 'Number series'.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na namba. Kila lugha ina neno kwa 'moja', na pia neno kwa 'mbili'. Pengine namba hizi zina maneno maalumu. Kwa hiyo, tumeingiza eneo la maana kwa 'moja' na lingine kwa 'mbili'. Pamoja na hayo eneo la maana lipo kwa namba zikiwa mfuatano (moja, mbili, tatu...). Lugha nyingi ina mfuatano zaidi ya moja wa namba (ya kwanza, ya pili, ya tatu...). Kwa hiyo tumeingiza eneo la maana kwa kila aina ya mfuatano uliopo kwenye lugha za dunia, kwa jumla. Ikiwepo kwamba lugha yako ina aina ya mfuatano wa namba mwingine uuingize katika eneo la maana 8.1.1.7 'mifuatano wa namba'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a written number?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja namba inayoandika?
(2) What words refer to a number of people or things?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja namba ya watu au vitu?
(3) What words describe different kinds of numbers?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea aina za namba mbalimbali?

ExampleWords.AUni: even, odd, positive, negative, infinite, cardinal, ordinal, whole, fraction, decimal,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to writing numbers on a series of things?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kuandika namba kwa mfuatano wa vitu?
(5) What words indicate that there are a particular number of something?
(5) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kuna namba fulani ya kitu fulani?

AStr.Run: The group <numbered> fifty.
Use this domain for words related to the cardinal numbers (one, two, three)--the numbers used to count.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na namba kamili (moja, mbili, tatu) -- yaani, namba zinazotumika kuhesabu.

Question.AUni: (1) What are the cardinal numbers? (the numbers you use when you count)
(1) Namba za kuhesabu zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: zero, one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen...
moja, mbili, tatu, nne, tano, sita, saba, nane, tisa, kumi, kumi na moja, kumi na mbili ...

Question.AUni: (2) multiples of ten
(2) Vigawe vya kumi vinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety
kumi, ishirini, thelathini, arobaini, hamsini, sitini, sabini, themanini, tisini

Question.AUni: (3) multiples of one hundred
(3) Vigawe vya mia vinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: mia moja, mia mbili, mia tatu, mia nne, mia tano, mia sita, mia saba, mia nane, mia tisa

Question.AUni: (4) multiples of one thousand
(4) Vigawe vya elfu vinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: elfu moja, elfu mbili, elfu tatu, elfu nne, elfu tano, elfu sita, elfu saba, elfu nane, elfu tisa, elfu kumi, ... laki

Question.AUni: (5) numbers larger than one thousand
(5) Namba zinazozidi elfu moja zinaitwaje?
(6) What words are used to refer to the numbers of a certain decimal place?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja vigawe vya namba za desimali (ushuria)?

ExampleWords.AUni: the digits, the tens, hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, trillions

Question.AUni: (7) What words are used to refer to groups of a certain decimal place?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja makundi ya namba?

ExampleWords.AUni: tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, millions, billions, trillions
dazeni (fungu la kumi na mbili), korija (fungu la ishirini), mamia, maelfu

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a very large number?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja namba kubwa sana?

ExampleWords.AUni: huge number, myriad, zillion, jillion, umpteen, googolplex,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to an unlimited number?
(9) Maneno gani hutaja namba isiwe na mwisho?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the number one. It appears that every language has a word for 'one' and 'two', but not every language has a word for the numbers higher than two. Many languages have several words that mean 'one'.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na namba moja. Inaonekana kwamba kila lugha ina neno kwa 'moja' na 'mbili', lakini siyo kila lugha ina neno kwa namba zikifuata 'mbili'. Pia lugha nyingi zina maneno kadhaa yaliyona maana ya 'moja'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to one?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja moja?

ExampleWords.AUni: one, first, individual, single, only, the one, one apiece, one each,

(8) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu kinatokea au kufanyika mara mbili?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the ordinal numbers (first, second, third)--the numbers used to indicate the order of something in a series, such as "the first child".

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na namba za mpango (ya kwanza, ya pili, ya tatu) -- yaani, namba zinazotumika kuonyesha nafasi ya kitu fulani katika mfuatano, k.m., "mtoto wa kwanza"

Question.AUni: (1) What are the ordinal numbers?
(1) Namba za mpango zinaitwaje?

ExampleWords.AUni: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seven, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, hundredth, thousandth,

AStr.Run: My parents had five boys and I am the <second>.; This book is the <third> in the series.

Use this domain for numbers that refer to the number of times something happens or is done. These numbers may be adverbs as in English (twice) or in some languages they may be verbs (to do something two times).

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayotaja tukio lilitokea mara ngapi. Inawezekana kwamba namba hizi zinaweza kuwa kielezi (kama Kiingereza) au katika lugha zingine zinaweza kuwa kitenzi (k.m., kufanya kitu mara mbili).

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the number of times something has happened? ("He fell down three times.")
(1) Maneno gani huelezea mara ngapi jambo fulani limetokea? ("Ameanguka mara tatu.")

ExampleWords.AUni: once, one time, single time, twice, two times, three times, thrice, four times, many times

AStr.Run: Mary washed the dress <three times>.; I have lent John money <many times>.; I have lent John money <twice>.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kuleta wingi kwa kitu fulani.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is two or three times the amount of something else?
(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kiasi ya kitu ni mara mbili au tatu zaidi kuliko kitu kingine?

ExampleWords.AUni: twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what,

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kuhesabu -- yaani, kusema namba katika taratibu yao, au kutumia namba ili kugundua kiasi.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words and affixes that indicate that there is more than one of something. Some languages, such as Indo-European languages, indicate plural with an affix. Other languages, such as Austronesian languages, use a separate word. Some languages also have words or affixes that indicate that there are two of something.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno na viambishi vinavyoonyesha kwamba vipo zaidi ya kitu fulani kimoja. Katika baadhi ya lugha, k.m., familia ya lugha zizungumzwazo sehemu za Ulaya na Magharibi ya Asia huonyesha wingi kwa kutumia kiambishi. Lugha zingine, k.m., famili ya lugha zizungumzwazo sehemu za Pasifika, hutumia maneno mawili yanayotenganishwa. Baadhi ya lugha pia zina maneno au viambishi ambavyo huonyesha kwamba vipo viwili tu vya kitu fulani.

(2) What words indicate that there are two of something?
(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba vipo viwili tu vya kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: all, whole, entire, the lot, every bit of, every inch of, every drop of, in its entirety, from start to finish, the whole of, totality,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to all of what you want?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja vitu vyote unavyovitaka?

ExampleWords.AUni: whatever, anything, everything but the kitchen sink, you name it,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something that affects or includes everything?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea jambo linalogusa kila kitu au lililopo pamoja na kila kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: total, blanket, overall, global, all-embracing, universal, all-pervading, complete, comprehensive, exhaustive, full, general, indiscriminate, sweeping, thorough, thoroughgoing, unmitigated, unqualified, utter, widespread, worldwide

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to all people?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja watu wote?

ExampleWords.AUni: everyone, everybody, anybody, whoever, whomever, whomsoever, whosoever,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to all times?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja mida yote?

ExampleWords.AUni: always, every time, any time, everyday,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to all places?
(7) Maneno ganih hutaja sehemu zote?
(8) What words refer to all ways?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja vyovyote?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to some--a number or amount of things or people when the number is not stated; an indefinite number or amount.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kiasi au namba isiyojulikana (siyo kurejea kiasi fulani ya jumla).

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate some of a group of things or people?
(1) Maneno gani huonyesha kiasi fulani ya kundi la vitu au watu ambayo siyo yote, yaani, ni baadhi ya vitu au watu hawa?

ExampleWords.AUni: some, any, several, a number of,

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate some of an amount of something?
(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kiasi fulani ya kitu fulani ambayo siyo yote?

ExampleWords.AUni: some, any, a certain amount of, a measure of,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that nothing, no one, never, and nowhere.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya hakuna kitu au bila -- yaani, hali ya idadi au kiasi ya kitu fulani kuwa sifuri.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to no thing?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: none, not any, no, nothing, not anything, be nil, bugger all,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to not any of a number of things?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna kitu ya vitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: none, not any, no, not one, not a, nothing,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to no person?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna mtu?
(4) What words refer to no time?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna muda?
(5) What words refer to no place?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja hakuna sehemu?
(6) What words refer to the number zero?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja sifuri?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to both of two things.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kuwepo kwa mambo yote mawili (au vitu vyote viwili, watu wote wawili n.k.).

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to both of two things?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja vyote viwili?

ExampleWords.AUni: both, the two of, the pair of, each, mutual, share, either, neither,

AStr.Run: I couldn't decide which of the two I wanted more, so I bought them both.; The plan would be to our <mutual> benefit.; We have a <mutual> friend.; They <share> the same name.
Use this domain for words related to most--more than half and less than all of something.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kiasi ambayo ni karibu yote -- yaani, zaidi ya nusu lakini siyo yote.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to most of something?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi ambayo ni karibu yote ya kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: most, almost all, nearly all, the majority, the bulk of, the better part of, the best part of, the lion's share, the biggest slice of the cake,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is done by most people?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea jambo linalofanyika na karibu wote?
(3) What words indicate that most of a group is of one kind.
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba karibu vyote vya kundi fulani ni ya aina moja?

ExampleWords.AUni: mostly, mainly, largely, predominantly, predominate, be in the majority, a preponderance,

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something more than anything else?
(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani hutokea zaidi kuliko mengine au mtu fulani hufanya jambo fulani zaidi kuliko mengine?

ExampleWords.AUni: mostly, mainly, in most cases, most of the time,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to less than half of something?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi ambayo ni chini ya nusu?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the most--the largest number or amount; or the least--the smallest number or amount. Most/least may refer to the largest/smallest number possible or needed. If there are several groups being counted, most/least may refer to the largest/smallest group.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na zaidi -- yaani, kiasi au idadi inayozidi zote; pia kuhusiana na kidogo -- yaani, kiasi au idadi ambayo ni chini ya zote. Zaidi/kidogo inaweza kuhusiana na kiasi au namba ambayo ni kubwa/ndogo zaidi kuliko zingine.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the largest amount of something?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi inayozidi zote zingine za kitu fulani?
(2) What words refer to the smallest amount of something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi inayozidiwa na zote zingine za kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: the least, minimum, the fewest, the lowest,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the largest group?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja kundi ambalo ni kubwa zaidi kuliko yote mengine?

AStr.Run: Who has the <most> children?

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the smallest group?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja kundi ambalo ni dogo zaidi kuliko yote mengine?
(5) What words refer to an amount being the largest it has ever been?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kiasi fulani kuwa zaidi kuliko ilivyowahi kuwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: an all-time high, record high, high water mark,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to an amount being the smallest it has ever been?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kiasi fulani kuwa chini zaidi kuliko ilivyowahi kuwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: an all-time low, record low, lowest ebb,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to a number or amount that is almost the same as another number.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na idadi au kiasi kuwa karibu sawasawa na idadi au kiasi nyingine?

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is almost a particular number or amount?
(1) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani ni karibu na idadi au kiasi fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, close to, close on, approaching, nearing, not quite, be pushing, pretty well,

AStr.Run: He is almost 100 years old.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that someone has almost reached a place?
(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba mtu amekaribia kufika sehemu fulani?

AStr.Run: We are <almost> there.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something has almost reached a particular state?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu au jambo fulani limekaribia kufika hali fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, very nearly, just about, practically, virtually, all but, as good as, to all intents and purposes, nearing, approaching, near to, close to, verging on, bordering on, more or less, pretty much, not quite,

AStr.Run: The clothes are <almost> dry.

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is almost finished?
(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani limekaribia kumalizwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, just about, practically, as good as, more or less, not quite,

AStr.Run: We are <almost> finished.

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that someone almost does something?
(5) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba mtu amekaribia kufanya jambo fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, very nearly, come close to, be on the verge of, come within an inch of,

AStr.Run: I <almost> hit you.

Question.AUni: (6) What words indicate that something almost happens?
(6) Maneno gani honyesha kwamba jambo fulani limekaribia kutokea?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, be near to, be on the brink of, come within an inch of,

AStr.Run: He <almost> died.

Question.AUni: (7) What words indicate that something is almost the best or worst example of some quality?
(7) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani ni karibu cha bora au cha baya kabisa kwa sifa fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, practically, virtually, just about, verging on, bordering on,

AStr.Run: He is <almost> the worst student in the school.

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something is so similar to something that it is almost the same thing?
(8) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani kinafanana sana na kingine mpaka kinakaribia kuwa sawasawa nacho?

AStr.Run: That dog is <almost> human.

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that something is almost some quality (such as some color or shape)?
(9) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba sifa fulani ya kitu fulani inalingana na sifa ileile ya kingine mpaka vimekaribia kuwa sawasawa (k.m., katika rangi, au sura).

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, more or less, practically, virtually, not quite,

AStr.Run: The road is <almost> straight.

Question.AUni: (10) What words indicate that something is true of or has happened to almost all of something?
(10) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani ni kweli kwa karibu wote/vyote au kwamba jambo fulani limetokea kwa karibu wote/vyote?

ExampleWords.AUni: almost, nearly, practically, virtually, pretty well, more or less, just about,

AStr.Run: <Almost> everyone is sick.
Use this domain for words referring to only a particular number or amount of people or things--no more than one, or no more than a particular number or amount.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kiasi au idadi maalumu ya watu au vitu -- yaani, kutozidi namba fulani na kutokuwa chini ya namba ileile.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe the only person or thing?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea mtu wa pekee ua kitu cha pekee?

ExampleWords.AUni: only, sole, the one, lone, solitary, alone, one and only, single,

AStr.Run: I had four brothers, but I am the <only> one who is still alive.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that there is only a particular number or amount of something?
(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kiasi maalumu ya kitu fulani ipo tu?

ExampleWords.AUni: only, just, no more than, all,

AStr.Run: We <only> have five chairs.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate something is true of only one thing or one group of things, and not true of others?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani ni kweli kwa kimoja au kundi la vitu moja, na siyo kweli kwa mengine.

ExampleWords.AUni: only, just, exclusively, nothing but, nothing else, be limited to, be restricted to, be confined to, be unique to, be peculiar to, exclusive,

AStr.Run: <Only> men can grow beards.

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is only what you say it is, and not something more?
(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani ni unavyosema lilivyo tu na siyo zaidi?

ExampleWords.AUni: only, just, purely, merely, mere, nothing but,

AStr.Run: He doesn't understand--he's <only> a child.; I don't want anything--I <only> want to help.
Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is exact--not more and not less.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoonyesha kwamba idadi au kiasi imekamilika kabisa -- yaani, kutozidi na kutopungukiwa.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is exact?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea idadi au kiasi ambayo ni kamili?

(2) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba idadi au kiasi ni kamili?
(3) What words indicate that something happens at an exact time?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linatokea katika muda fulani kamili?

ExampleWords.AUni: exactly, precisely, on the dot, sharp,

AStr.Run: John begins at <exactly> 6 a.m.

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something happens at an exact place?
(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linatokea katika sehemu fulani kamili?
(5) What words describe something that is exactly the same as another thing?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambachi ni sawasawa kamili na kingine?

ExampleWords.AUni: exact, accurate, faithful, strict, literal, word for word, just

Question.AUni: (6) What words indicate that something is done in exactly the right way?
(6) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linafanyikiwa katika njia fulani kamili?

ExampleWords.AUni: exactly, strictly, religiously, to the letter,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is approximate.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na kiasi au idadi kukaribia kuwa kiasi au idadi fulani. Eneo la maana hili ni tofauti kidogo na eneo la maana 8.1.5.6 "karibu". Katika eneo la maana 8.1.5.6 unajua idadi au kiasi inayokaribiwa, lakini katika eneo la maana hili hujui kamili kiasi au idadi ya kitu fulani. Ni kama unabahitisha kidogo kiasi au idadi iliyopo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is approximate?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea idadi au kiasi ambayo ni kadirio?

AStr.Run: We need to know the <approximate> weight of his suitcase.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is not exact?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea kiasi fulani ambayo siyo kamili?

ExampleWords.AUni: inexact, inaccurate, sort of, kind of,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that a particular number or amount is approximate?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba idadi au kiasi fulani ni kadirio?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, approximately, roughly, give or take, at a guess, somewhere in the region of, an estimated, some, something like, in round numbers, close to,

AStr.Run: It weighs <about> four kilos.; John walks <approximately> two miles a day.

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly more?
(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kadirio la kiasi lakini kiasi iliyopo inaweza kuzidi kadirio lile?

ExampleWords.AUni: or so, odd, or more, at least, and maybe more, barely, hardly, little more than, scarcely,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly less?
(5) Maneno gani huonyesha kadirio la kiasi lakini kiasi iliyopo inaweza kuwa chini ya kadirio lile?

ExampleWords.AUni: at most, as much as, short of,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to determining the approximate number of amount of something?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kugundua kadirio la kiasi au idadi ya kitu fulani?

(7) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kukadiria kiasi kwa kumi, mia, au elfu iliyopo karibu nayo?

ExampleWords.AUni: rounded to the nearest ten/hundred/thousand, round up, round down,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a number that is approximate?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja idadi au kiasi ambayo ni kadirio?

ExampleWords.AUni: estimate (n), approximation, ballpark figure, round figure,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate time?
(9) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linatokea katika muda usio kamili?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, around, approximately, round about, or thereabouts, circa, some time,

Question.AUni: (10) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate place?
(10) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linatokea katika sehemu isiyo kamili?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, around, in the vicinity of, near, close to,

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
(11) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho ni karibu sawa na kingine?
(12) What words indicate that something is done in approximately the right way?
(12) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba jambo fulani linafanyika katika njia inayokaribia kuwa sahihi?
(13) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
(13) Maneno gani huelezea jambo ambalo siyo kadirio wala kamili?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing a whole thing--all of something with no parts missing.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea jambo lililokamilika -- yaani, vitu vyote vya kitu fulani bila kukosa hata kidogo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is whole?
(1) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani ni kizima au kimekamilika?

ExampleWords.AUni: complete, full, whole, in full, in its entirety, be all there, all of, entire, intact, undivided, united,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to making something complete?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kufanya kitu kiwe kizima au kikamilike?
(3) What words indicate that something is not whole?

AStr.Run: Many things have parts. Use this domain for words referring to a part of something, and for words that express the idea that something has parts, that something is a part of something, or that link the whole with a part.

Vitu vingine vina sehemu zake. Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na sehemu ya kitu fulani, na kwa maneno yanayoelezea dhana kwamba kitu fulani kina sehamu, kwamba kitu fulani ni sehemu ya kingine, au kwamba kitu fulani kinaunganisha kitu kizima na sehemu nyingine.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a part of something?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu ya kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: part, bit, portion, section, segment, sample, cross-section, member,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the parts that something is made from?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu ambazo kitu fulani kinatenganeza nazo?
(3) What words refer to the parts of a process?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja hatua au sehemu za mfuatano wa mambo?
(4) What words refer to the parts of an organization?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu (au idara) za shirika?

ExampleWords.AUni: branch, department, division, section, sector, wing, end, subdivision,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the parts of a story?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu za hadithi?

ExampleWords.AUni: episode, installment, chapter, scene, part, extract, excerpt, clip,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the parts of a situation?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu za tatizo fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: aspect, side, dimension, facet, factor, feature, detail,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to being a part of something?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwa sehemu ya kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: be part of, form a part of, inherent,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something has parts?
(8) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani kina sehemu?

ExampleWords.AUni: have, of, -'s, consist of, be made of, be made up of, be composed of, comprise, be divided into, include

AStr.Run: Many animals <have> four feet.; The story <is composed of> several episodes.; This page <is part of> that document.; the wheel <of> the car; the boy<'s> foot
Use this domain for words referring to a part of something that has been broken or cut off.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na sehemu ya kitu fulani ambayo imevunjika au kukatika.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a piece of something?

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a piece that has flat sides?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kipande kilichona janibu zilizo sawasawa?
(3) What words refer to a piece that is irregular in shape?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja kipande ambacho hakina mfumo wa kawaida?
(4) What words refer to a thin piece?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja kipande chembamba?
(5) What words refer to a very small piece?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kipande kidogo sana?

ExampleWords.AUni: grain, flake, speck, fleck, crumb, morsel, tidbit, dot, mote,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to a small piece that is left after something has been broken?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja kipande kidogo kinachobaki baada ya kitu fulani kupasuka?
(7) What words refer to a part of something that has been made by dividing it in some way?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja kipande ambacho kimetenganezwa kwa kugawanyika kwa njia moja au nyingine?

ExampleWords.AUni: pinch (of salt), cut (of meat), slice (of bread), bite (of cake)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being or having enough--to have as much of something or as many of something as you need or want.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kuwa au kuwa na ya kutosha -- yaani, kuwa na kadiri unavyotaka au kuhitaji.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that you have enough of?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea jambo ulilona la kutosha?

ExampleWords.AUni: enough, sufficient, adequate, satisfactory, enough to go round,

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that there is enough of something for what you need?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea kwamba kiasi iliyopo inatosheleza mahitaji yako?

ExampleWords.AUni: be enough, do, suffice, cover, last, meet someone's needs, get by, afford to,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that someone is strong enough or old enough to do something?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea kwamba kitu fulani kina nguvu ya kutosha au kuwepo kwa muda wa kutosha kwa shughuli fulani?

AStr.Run: John <is> strong enough to walk now.

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a situation in which someone does enough or something happens enough?
(4) Maneno gani huelezea hali ya mtu fulani kufanya ya kutosha au kwa jambo fulani kufanyikiwa kwa kutosha?

ExampleWords.AUni: do enough, sufficiently, adequacy, adequately, satisfactorily, sufficiency,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to having enough of something?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwa na ya kutosha ya kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: have enough, be OK for, be all right for, be well off for, have sufficient,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to having enough of something to do what you want?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwa na ya kutosha ya kitu fulani ili ufanye ulivyopanga?

ExampleWords.AUni: have the time/money, can afford, can spare, run to,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to having more than enough, but not too much?
(7) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwa na zaidi kuliko kiasi inayotosha, lakini siyo kuzidi sana sana?
(8) What words refer to not having enough?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja kutokuwa na ya kutosha?

ExampleWords.AUni: not enough, insufficient, too little, too few, scarce, inadequate, inadequacy, shortage, lack of, be in short supply, be short,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that there is not enough of something for what you need?
(9) Maneno gani huelezea kwamba hakipo cha kutosha cha kitu kwa shughuli unayoifanya?

ExampleWords.AUni: not be enough, be running short, not last, won't last,

Question.AUni: (10) What words indicate that someone is not strong enough or old enough to do something?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the remainder of something--the part or amount of something that remains behind after the other parts have been taken away. Something can be left because everything else has been used or eaten, or everything else has been destroyed or burned.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na salio la kitu fulani -- yaani, sehemu au kiasi inayobaki baada ya sehemu zingine kuchukuliwa. Kitu kinachobaki kwa sababu vyote vingine vimeshatumika au kulika, au vyote vingine vimeharibika au vimechomeka.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something remaining?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kitu kubaki?

ExampleWords.AUni: left, remain, be left over, survive, be still standing, to spare, to go, in hand,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the remainder?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja kinachobaki, yaani, salio?

ExampleWords.AUni: the remains, remnants, leftovers, ruins, what is left of, what remains of, the rest, the remainder, the last of, residue,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the bad part that remains after the good part has been taken?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu mbaya inayobaki baada ya sehemu zingine nzuri kuchukuliwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: butt, dregs, leavings, offscourings, rags, scraps, sweepings,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a very small part that remains?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu ndogo sana inayobaki?
(5) What words describe something that remains?
(5) Maneno gani huelezea kinachobaki?

ExampleWords.AUni: remaining, last, outstanding, spare, leftover, residual, surplus, surviving,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being long. In many languages there is more than one system of measuring length. These systems may be used for different purposes or in different jobs. For instance measuring the length of an object may use different words than measuring the distance a person travels.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kuwa ndefu. Katika lugha nyingi upo zaidi ya mmoja utaratibu wa kupima urefu. Utaratibu hizi zinaweza kutumika kwa shughuli na nia tofautitofauti. K.m., kupima urefu wa kitu fulani kunaweza kutumia maneno tofauti na kupima umbali wa safari fulani.

ExampleWords.AUni: make something longer, lengthen, extend, stretch,

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoonyesha kwamba kitu fulani kiko chini -- yaani, hewani lakini siyo juu sana.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is low?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kilichopo chini?
(2) What words describe something that is very low?
(2) Maneno gani( huelezea kitu kilichopo chini sana?

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something is low?
(3) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu kiko chini?
(4) What words refer to becoming low?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kushuka chini kidogo?
(5) What words refer to making something low?

(8) What words refer to being lower than another thing?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwepo chini zaidi kuliko kingine?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being deep or shallow--how far something such as a hole extends below the ground or other surface, or how far something is below the surface of the water.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kuwa na kina cha urefu fulani - yaani, urefu wa kitu (kama shimo) unaoenda chini ya ardhi au uso wa kitu fulani, au umbali wa kitu fulani kilichopo chini ya uso wa maji.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is deep?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja urefu wa kwenda chini?

ExampleWords.AUni: deep, deeply, deep-seated, in the depths, deep down,
ndefu kwenda chini, kina, uketo, lindi

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is very deep?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea urefu wa kwenda chini sana?

ExampleWords.AUni: knee-deep, waist-deep, over your head, out of your depth,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a deep place?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu yenye kina kikubwa?

ExampleWords.AUni: the depths, channel, trench, gulf, abyss,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to something becoming deep?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kikisababishwa kuwa na urefu wa kwenda chini?
(6) What words refer to making something deep?

(7) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kuwa na urefu wa kwenda chini mkubwa zaidi kuliko kingine?
(8) What words refer to how deep something is?

(9) What words indicate how deep something is?
(9) Maneno gani huonyesha urefu wa kwenda chini wa kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: how deep, be (ten feet) deep, (ten feet) in depth, at a depth of (ten feet), plunge (ten feet),

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to measuring how deep something is?
(10) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupima urefu wa kwenda chini?

(11) Zana gani hutumika kwa kupima urefu wa kwenda chini?

(13) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kilicho na urefu wa kwenda chini mdogo?

ExampleWords.AUni: shallow, not deep, skin-deep, superficial, surface,

Question.AUni: (14) What words refer to a shallow place?
(14) Maneno gani hutaja sehemu yenye kina kidogo?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something fitting--when something is not too big or too small, but just right.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kitu kukaa vizuri -- yaani, kitu kisicho kikubwa sana wala kidogo sana, kimefaa kabisa tu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something fitting?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kitu kukaa vizuri?

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that fits?

(3) What words refer to making something tight?

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na hali ya kulegea -- yaani, kitu kikiwa kikubwa sana.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is loose?

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is stuck?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho kimekwama?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to measuring something--to find out the size, length, weight, or amount of something.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kupima kitu fulani -- yaani, kugundua ukubwa, urefu, uzito, au kiasi ya kitu fulani.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to measuring something?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupima kitu?

ExampleWords.AUni: measure, take a measurement, assay, assess, balance, calibrate, determine, fathom, gauge, grade, mete, meter, pace, plumb, quantify, rank, reach, read, take a reading, record, rule, sound, span, step off, stretch, stride, survey, tape, test, time,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the size or amount of something?
(2) Maneno ganihutaja ukubwa au kiasi ya kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: capacity, dimension, distance, extent, length, measure, portion, quantity, size, volume,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that can be measured?
(3) Maneno gani huelezea kitu ambacho inawezekana kukipima?
(4) What words refer to the number or amount that you get when you measure something?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja idadi au kiasi inayopatikana unapopima kitu fulani?
(5) What general words refer to a unit of measure?
(5) Maneno gani ya kawaida hutaja kizio cha kipimo, kwa jumla?
(6) What words indicate that something is a particular size or amount?
(6) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu fulani kina ukubwa au kiasi fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: is, measure (v), weigh, how big, of

AStr.Run: two kilos <of> sugar

Question.AUni: (7) What instruments are used to measure something?
(7) Zana gani hutumika kwa kupima kitu fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: abacus, almanac, beam, calendar, caliper, chain, chronometer, clock, compass, dial, gauge, instrument, level, line, micrometer, plumb, protractor, quadrant, rod, rule, ruler, sextant, square, straightedge, tape, tapeline, thermometer, watch, yardstick,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to an amount that cannot be measured?
(8) Maneno gani hutaja kiasi ambayo haiwezekani kuipima?

ExampleWords.AUni: immeasurable, measureless, incalculable, unfathomable, unmeasured, untold,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to weighing something.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na tendo la kupima uzito wa kitu.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to weighing something?
(1) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kupima uzito wa kitu?

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the weight of something?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja uzito wa kitu?

AStr.Run: What is the <weight> of a liter of water?

(3) Maneno gani hutaja kizio cha uzito?

ExampleWords.AUni: ounce, pound, ton, milligram, centigram, decigram, gram, dekagram, kilo, kilogram, metric ton, kiloton, megaton, atomic weight, carat, dram, grain, hundredweight, pennyweight, stone, talent, gross weight, net weight,

(4) Maneno gani huonyesha kwamba kitu kina uzito fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: is, weigh, how heavy, weigh in at,

Question.AUni: (5) What instruments are used to weigh something?
(5) Zana gani hutumika kwa kupima uzito wa kitu fulani?

AStr.Run: I have a <scale> we can use to weigh the rice.

ExampleWords.AUni: support, carry, hold, load, weight, pressure,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is flat--having a surface that is even. A board or wall is flat when its surface is even and it does not bend.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayohusiana na vitu vyenye bapa, yaani vyenye sehemu ya juu iliyo sawa. Ubao au ukuta ni mwenye bapa uso wake ukiwepo sawasawa na hakuna sehemu inainuka juu hata kidogo.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is flat?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kilicho na bapa?

ExampleWords.AUni: flat, flat as a pancake, even, flush,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to making something flat?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusababisha kitu kiwe na bapa?

ExampleWords.AUni: flatten, even (v), even out, smooth, level, roll something flat, press, squish, squash, smash, mash, spread thin

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something becoming flat?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kikisababishwa kuwa na bapa?

(5) What words describe something that is not flat?

ExampleWords.AUni: rough, bumpy, uneven, lumpy, hilly, rolling, mountainous,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing a horizontal orientation in relation to the ground or something that is level--a flat surface that does not rise in any direction. A person is horizontal when he is sleeping. A field is level when it is not on a hill and it has no uneven areas in it.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea kitu ambacho ni sawa, yaani sehemu yake ya juu ina bapa isichoinuka katika mwelekeo wowote.

(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kilicho na mwelekeo wa mlalo?

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to becoming horizontal?
(2) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kupata mwelekeo wa mlalo?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall on your face, fall prone, prostrate oneself, get horizontal, fall flat, hit the dirt, lay flat

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to causing something to be horizontal?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusababisha kitu fulani kipate mwelekeo wa mlalo?

ExampleWords.AUni: lay something flat, lay something down, align

(5) What words refer to making something level?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kusababisha kitu kiwe sawa?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is proper for a particular time, place, purpose, or job. The words in this domain involve a comparison between two things, an item and a setting. An evaluation is made as to how good the item is in the setting. The words may be used only of certain types of items, certain types of settings, or certain types of usefulness.

Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea jambo, k.m., zana au njia ya kufanya jambo fulani, lililo sahihi au la kufaa kwa muda, sehemu, nia, au kazi fulani. Maneno ya eneo la maana hili yanahusiana na kulinganisha vitu viwili, kitu fulani na mkao wake. Tathmini inafanyika ili kuona kama zana ili inafaa kwa mkao ule. Inawezekana kwamba maneno haya yanatumika kwa aina fulani za zana, au aina fulani za mikao, au aina fulani za utumiaji.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is proper?
(1) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachofaa?

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, applicable, apposite, apropos, becoming, befitting, correspond, correspondent, corresponding, decent, due, expected, felicitous, germane, meet, opportune, pertinent, pleasing, principled, properly, right-minded, rightful, smart, suitable, suited, timely, well, well-timed,
kufaa, kustahili, kustahiki, sawa, sahihi, halisi

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is right for a particular job?
(2) Maneno gani huelezea kitu kinachofaa kwa shughuli fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, accepted, approved, appropriate, correct,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something being right for a particular job?
(3) Maneno gani hutaja hali ya kitu kufaa kwa shughuli fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: suit, lends itself to, be suited to, be cut out for, be made for, fit the bill, fit in, be right for, be the right person for, make a good/ideal,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something someone does that is right for a particular situation?
(4) Maneno gani hutaja kitu kinachofanyika na mtu na kinachofaa kwa hali au mkao fulani?

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, acceptable, appropriate, apt, correct, fitting, suitable, be the done thing, be the way it's done, in keeping with,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to doing something in the right way?
(5) Maneno gani hutaja tendo la kufanya kitu katika njia iliyo sahihi?

ExampleWords.AUni: right, properly, correctly, by the book,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the quality of being proper?
(6) Maneno gani hutaja sifa ya kufaa?

Or something in nature such as a sunset or flower may inspire awe and wonder.
Tumia eneo la maana hili kwa maneno yanayoelezea sura ya kitu kinachopendeza sana na kusababisha heshima na mshangao, k.m. jumba la mfalme, hekalu lililorembwa au machweo yenye rangi nyingi.
